4MysKq4AxZOyOFOyaJF8TQ.text: I've been driving by this spot a few times and finally got a chance to check it out. When we first walked in we were immediately greeted by the friendly staff. The atmosphere and ambient has a very modern/hipster feel (which I love). The menus is simple yet you have a variety of foods that will cater to just about anyone.  Our waiter described the menu as a "scale above street truck food" which to an extent, I agreed...  However, in my personal opinion I felt that the food was so much more. The food was fresh, well seasoned, and just tasty. We had the ceviche tostadas, burger, fish tacos, and finished off with the churro ice cream sandwich. I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant.

aHkhZz5auxcoIF4VGOPhSQ.text: Came here because it was highly recommended.  I had the noodle salad which was amazing and the ceviche.  The food was great, the service was awesome, they are all very friendly and would come back again!

aMUltxvC3s3p_Khn5YwfIw.text: Great food and drink! I wish the building was a little larger and the waiters are slow to return and ask for your order.

8wZa_DgNKgYo7d3WCsrprg.text: We just discovered a new restaurant near the University Banner Medical Center at 3rd St and Rosevelt. It is unassuming from the outside, but give it a chance! My goodness, the food was wonderful. We had the fish tacos and the Korean Yakisobi. Excellent! Everything is made in house. The wait staff was great and the host was friendly and full of information. Definitely going to be back!

agX2LDdOX6bFrVMVsdYqtA.text: My husband's burger and fries were great, but I was a little let down by the veggie tacos. The veggie taco mainly consisted of sweet potatoes that were undercooked, corn, and a huge piece of fried cheese. Had I known about the cheese, I probably would've ordered the fried fish taco instead. Someone next to us ordered it and it looked really good.

zpizDtAZFWmkCQHUzCP0-g.text: Came here to grab some burgers and were very pleasantly surprised with how nice and modern this place is. Frys and burgers are tits. Great house music and the customer service was outstanding. Come with a date or the older kids.

rbH2MH-3caQIKNyVFJnwOA.text: Had the veggie tacos and a fantastic cup of chai. Totally delish.

jmM_C-9yEZCYPRtfMnCkUg.text: One of the best in the city. Loved the ceviche, loved the pickles, wife devoured the soba salad, the kids crushed the all day burrito and I swear the RoRo burger was outstanding. Beers, cocktails, happy hour and a killer staff. Churro ice cream sandwich is a great finisher. The fam cannot wait to come back. Thanks Dressing Room

2mRnDivsYHFDpq3d2Tmsdg.text: This place is amazing... I am visiting from LA and the music, vibe and food is amazing!! Love it!!

rcohieww2OnyFmGnjYlAGQ.text: Went here today, Friday for lunch.  WOW.  What a great place.  Husband and son had Roro burgers which they loved, as well as the fries which they said were out of this world.  I had the amazing and delicious TJ tacos- so good.  Also great that they have happy hour prices if you would like to imbibe.  Great service, great food, great prices.  Eat here!

dqCUD1JLQgjiAUBSvUYGnQ.text: Great food and service! They tuned the music down when requested, turned on misters, turned off misters and generally made our lunch comfortable and yummy!! We will be back!!

qwZoYVkBAKGYlMCt5Ekvjg.text: Came here for lunch last Thursday, and now it's Monday, and I have been craving it all weekend. Had the Soba Salad and it was simply delicious. Several people in my group had the All-Day Breakfast Burrito (meatless version), someone else had the veggie tacos, and everyone left happy. Some of the group had cocktails, including the one that blended Mexican Coke, iced coffee, and tequila: amazing. I can't recommend this enough. It's such a cute location, the food is delicious, and while the weather is nice, the outdoor patio is lovely. Could not be more impressed!

VDlD5HAe2wYUNDDgUysNeA.text: Had a Classic Burger on a homemade muffin. It's was quite tasty, real Angus beef with high quality vegetables. Then their salads are amazing, one with this coconut vinaigrette type. Staff is super friendly, willing to cater any need, will recommend and be back!

RoDPr8_ZVefxSftFlSFRxg.text: Two words - Veggie Tacos! They were delish, it was happy hour all day and the service was great. Perfect stop for a late lunch!

YIfqDW5pUj8IqM5F_aF6eA.text: Fantastic food in a welcoming environment.  Sat at the counter and got friendly service and banter from the whole kitchen staff.  Tacos delicious as are the fries (get all 3 sauces!).

c64I2hF1swULi2W1ta_jtw.text: My coworkers and I are here on an off night.  The drink menu is fantastic, the food very good, but the atmosphere and vibe is what truly sets it apart.  Lastly, sit on the patio and you can thank me later.

wUG1zbO3WKvN2lG5LZ1uIw.text: I'm from out of town and found this place in Yelp. The food is amazing and the service exceeded my expectations. I totally recommend it.

wW0X_PbJdZ2LCV-z6KpFRA.text: This place was great, I ordered another dinner afterwards the burger was delicious. The butter lettuce mouth watering. The ice cream love it. The drinks from the bar nice job on that too. The atmosphere is a nice Kicked back vibe, soothing music going. Nice job dressing room.

yPoKPzDxePqGb_MB2FpQlA.text: One of the best additions to the dining scene in DT PHX --- small quaint little restaurant with a small outdoor back patio. Has a unique alt vibe. Great place to go for a small bite and a drink (esp. during happy hour where all drinks are half off). $3 tostada and pico has been great both times I've been there --- ask for some avocado crema on the side (+0.50). Miso slaw ($3) also a winner. Fish tacos and soba noodles were spot on. This is a place I'll most definitely be returning to despite the many dining options downtown.

Q6wC8ZhTX-NPr10sdNQPPA.text: The service was superb from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. I had no idea walking in how little the place was or that it is connected to the Monarch which I thought was actually very cool and different. Although there wasn't a lot of indoor seating there seemed to be more outside (if only it wasn't so hot this time of year!). Myself and a friend sat at the bar top and enjoyed watching three men cook right in front of us in the tiny kitchen. I tried the 2 fish tacos and the ceviche salad. Both were very good. I really liked how unique and fresh the salad was. The tacos were good and simple, but could have used some more seasoning or flavor.

7egs8nBElPubvRb0vGNdeg.text: Enjoyed late night drinks and dessert here at The Dressing Room. You MUST try the Churro Ice Cream! The vanilla bean ice cream was rich and the Churro was crunchy and perfectly sweet. It even stayed crispy while soaking up the ice cream. It was the perfect companion to a night cap!

4qiy508FyOOEzWaB0j3wGg.text: Happy hour is a must, their drinks are fantastic. Had the burger on a brioche bun, my favorite burger in the valley thus far.

QCGGCLJWLuNPG247yrtwpg.text: The Ro-ro burger is unlike any other. Food is inventive and delicious. Has a hip vibe without being pretentious, definitely worth checking out.

5dR5lf4ViBFZpEeSPTzQqA.text: Used to be the best restaurant in phoenix.... The classic burger was the BEST. BURGER. EVER. but they got rid of it?!? It's awkward cause we have recommend the burgers to dozens of people and then they go and call me and say they don't even have it... man they need to get it back. my friends and are going to protest!

fZTj-kb69-DeJ2_h0xJP1g.text: Lovely spot for lunch. I never have a problem getting a table, the service is always quick, and the food is damned delicious. The dipping sauces for the fries are each worth trying, but the malt aioli is top notch in my book.  Burgers on English muffins is something that needs to be more popular. They're the perfect vessel for it. Both burgers on the menu here are great. If you're in the mood for something richer, I'd recommend the all day breakfast burrito.   Extra bonus: delicious coffee and pastries, a plant shop, and an art gallery right next door!

rFr7qIm4fKB6oXs2BZ2gyQ.text: Met friends at the Dressing Room to celebrate a birthday...  Chelsea was wonderful! Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered multiple items for sharing while enjoying beautiful cocktails. I'll definitely be back! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheers!

x4nAeUMqnDIrgLGCZQzPNQ.text: This was the first place we ate when visiting Phoenix and it might have been the best! We showed up during happy hour so drinks were half off...and delicious.   The cold noodle Cobb salad was fresh and flavorful (we also ordered a beef skewer) and the the veggie tacos were the BEST tacos I've ever eaten. Literally full of deep fried queso cheese, what more can you ask for?

ZtgbzAKPQ85nACKx1ytI8w.text: Hands down one of the best places to eat downtown! We been wanting to try this place for sometime now, and decided to give it a chance Saturday night. Service was great and fast! Food came out hot!! We will defiantly be returning soon:)

eznfnRoXfbbr7L1pUL5e6w.text: So much to say about this place, but this is supposed to be a review and not an article so I'll make it brief.  FULL DISCLOSURE: I've only tried the burgers and fries here. If they're any indication of the rest of the food than everything is a must-try.   Take a moment to ask yourself, what makes a good burger joint? Have a few ideas in your head?   Is it the quality of the meat? Quality of the fries? Whether the place has a unique twist? Good Service? Consistency?  I'm here to tell you The Dressing Room has all of that. Any burger spot can have a home run on a given night only for them to strike out on your next visit. I've been here on at least 5 separate occasions, and it has rocked me EVERY SINGLE TIME. I honestly can't tout that level of consistency about any other burger spot in Phoenix or anywhere else for that matter.  Only con I can think of is the parking situation, but that's easy to get over after you've tasted the food and experienced the fantastic level of service.   I'm sure if I asked you for your favorite burger joint, you'd have a name in mind. If you live in Phoenix, you should be skeptical of that top spot until you've tried The Dressing Room.

4J9BOihBNaN4p8pktOScQA.text: Excellent cocktails- the South American Sour has a nice spicy kick.  Shared several dishes and they were all delicious. Good service, fun vibe.

9uQf5JpYP31T7uTXkSZMvQ.text: Can you just move to my neighborhood? Music that's always right. Vibe and decor that amplify each other. Good food. Fine cocktailing. Unfailingly warm and friendly service. And they have a poster of lyrics up from the Black Keys along with Boba Fett. Come on! If you can't love this place you've misplaced your heart!   Back again. Can I just take you home with me?!  You get all the major and minor bits right.

uI4gxLEp3HbcZBOcd3EPpg.text: What a great place! It's unbelievable! The happy hour is from 11-6! The beer, wine and cocktails are all half price. The cocktails are incredibly creative and amazing! The people working there are super nice! If you are in the area, this  is a definite stop you should make along the way! You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is THE ROSEMARY &amp; THE SAGE! JUST DELICIOUS!

l0TPxWHiDTnMAn4i_gkKTg.text: Highly recommend this place. The fish and shrimp tacos were perfection. Extra friendly people who really care about their finished product. Good vibe from the second we walked in. Definitely going back to try the churro ice cream sandwich next time.

ShkVQAqokV7bECf4eKQBIw.text: I specifically came here to try their churro ice cream sandwich after reading a Phoenix New Times post that raves about them. Unfortunately I didn't hold the same feelings they did. The churro was missing cinnamon, and was so thin that it became crispy all the way through, instead of having that doughey middle that churros are meant to have. And the vanilla ice cream needed more vanilla. It tasted like only cream. I'll come back here to try their food because some of it sounds interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

S6_gCXwkv4dTSTnjaObz-Q.text: My girlfriend and I have been here twice and have loved everything we've eaten. They have a short menu but they've mastered what they have on it.   Their burgers raise the standards for a burger and their tacos get two thumbs up.

KTAkNG0c3mcc05c3J9P3tw.text: I have eaten here a couple years ago with friends and it was delightful. At the time, the vegetarian option available was a delicious veggie taco that was to die for. My friends enjoyed their meals as well and we all shared an amazing churro ice cream sandwich. It's a small space but hip and elegant. A couple months ago, I was so excited to go there to eat that vegetarian option, only to sit down and see the menu changed entirely. The veggie taco now had seafood. I asked the lovely server if it were possible to make the taco vegetarian again and was told no. She explained that everything on the menu had changed except 2 options. I couldn't find anything on the menu that was vegetarian friendly aside from a chilled pad thai salad which didn't seem filling or offer the same kind of warm comfort I was looking for. We had to leave because... a girl's gotta eat. I have to say that I am incredibly disappointed that this would change because it was the ONE vegetarian friendly item on the whole menu and it was GOOD. In a hip area of Phoenix in 2019, you would think there would be at least one meatless option. Hopefully this doesn't last long, but until it does I sadly won't dine there anymore. Still giving the restaurant 3 stars because they do a fabulous job otherwise and my precious experiences were great.

IntKDI_3m7gnPZOnmp4ytw.text: Phone menu great service wonderful hip ambienceI mean you has a great price. Burgers are wonderful

mh93-88MB6tgjOof6CbcFQ.text: Cool vibe to this place. Menu is eclectic but my kids all still found something they loved and ate well (I have four boys who can be very picky eaters). Coop space to the coffee house next door is cool and we liked the industrial/art studio feel to the decor. Food, staff, and drinks were outstanding. Loved the desserts.

soM6twuINp4yZ-Q2RWHZyg.text: This place makes me so happy. The employees are so friendly and awesome, the location is A+, the prices are super reasonable, and the food is great! It can be pretty loud when it's crowded but personally I don't mind that at all. The menu is also on the smaller side but I also see that as a positive. I've taken friends there several times and all of us have left super satisfied every time.  Things I can recommend: -veggie tacos -sitting on their patio when it's not one trillion degrees outside

HKc-ns0KsNq28A24ByevhA.text: Fun atmosphere, wait staff was attentive and gave good recommendations. We came here on a Thursday ~4:30 and the happy hour was awesome (50% off). The fish tacos were delish.

y8M8EoD8T0VRCBwP7lTJKw.text: My girlfriend and I have been here multiple times, for dates,with friends, and most recently at the Chile Festival. The food and service has been spectacular every time. We recommend this place frequently and are likely taking my family next time they visit.  Shout out to Chef Kevin for his creation at the Chile Festival. It was truly the best of the festival.

b6lYRYV7EpFBYMOKQe1bZA.text: Great Quaint restaurant. friendly customer service, and fantastic food I love their happy hour! Great place to visit if you're downtown.

jGcsgRW1HtC7h5SP5dM4qQ.text: Classic burger was as good as I've had,  fries were excellent,  and sidewalk ambience was enjoyable.  The price couldn't be better, maybe because my daughters paid ( but they said they were quite satisfied as well).

oSWRyLVggMvqAk2aaIP4YA.text: This wonderful place was recommended by Julia at The Bee's Knees. Our lunch was terrific - shared the RoRo Burger & the mixed street tacos, which had 1 fish & 1 veggie taco. All were excellent. Amanda was very helpful & informative about other local things to do in the area.

Kly91J_Jdy_Xroz3GBmSMQ.text: Stopped by here on a road trip after seeing the great reviews. The food was incredible. I order the Korean Yakitori and loved it. Service and environment were cool too. Would come here regularly if I lived in the area.

lh0vZRmkcYgGa6vc5Kf3Og.text: Modern and industrial neighborhood gem on Roosevelt. This spot has quickly become a favorite of mine and as reluctant as I am to share with the masses, it deserves to be enjoyed by many. And let's be real, I need this place to thrive so I have a place to go on my afternoons. I'll cut to the goodies you want (why we all yelp in the first place...)  Reasons why I love this place:  - Consistent and attentive (without bugging) service. From my very first visit, I was treated like a friend coming over for a drink. I feel comfortable coming here alone to work and study and never feel rushed. Food comes up quickly and thus far, I've never had something I didn't like and never had an order arrive wrong.  - EXCELLENT FOOD AND COCKTAILS! Seriously. Try the Roro burger or fish tacos. TBH, everything is delicious AF. Can't go wrong. Sauces are flavor-packed, food is cooked to order, and is plated (or basketed?) with care. It's in the little details here and they've impressed me with their attention to them.  - A REAL Happy hour. None of that "we just have a drink special or $1 off wells/ tap/ etc." They do half off all alcoholic beverages including ALL of their lovely cocktails! I've always been meh about Paloma's but this place has made me fall in love with them. Happy hour is from open to 6pm I believe.  - The atmosphere. Interesting music, small business feel, beautiful patio, simple and cute plant-based centerpieces. If you sit at the bar (you may find me there) it feels like you have a coveted kitchen seat with prime access to the bartender.   TLDR. Eat here. Drink Here. You'll Enjoy it.

P5PVsxwlpgSEtPLk0keqWg.text: I really, really liked this place. It was so cute and cozy, the service was amazing and the food was absolutely delicious! The prices are also great for the portions. We were able to meet the manager, who was so friendly and you could tell that he took pride in this restaurant. We tried their ceviche, fish and chips and salad. All three were so good. Can't wait to go back to this place again!

CQHEvPP7odX6sRvnztvE7g.text: I was so excited this space finally opened. I've been following The Dressing Room since the Kickstarter campaign a few years ago. After having dinner and drinks last night, I'm happy to say it was well worth the wait. Everything, from the service to the food to the drinks, was outstanding. We ate outside on the patio, and fell in love with the atmosphere too. For balance sake, I'll mention this: the two different cocktails I had were a little sweet for dinner. Both would make excellent brunch drinks. I had something called a "C. V." something with tequila--my drug of choice, and a bourbon drink with sage. Delicious, but better for brunch. I can and will walk over to this outstanding eatery often.

qAw4l-YScVL-lJwYfjU4WQ.text: After a day of wandering and exploring downtown Phoenix, I found my way into The Dressing Room. A cool spot with a very cool vibe. I sat out on the back patio, ordered the Classic Burger and proceeded to fall in love. It was amazing. The ingredients were all wonderfully simple and came together to make one of the best burgers I've ever had. I was so fucking happy eating every last piece. I can't wait to come back again.

wXy7OjbBaQFTfHPOVCcENQ.text: Amazing food and great service. We are new to town and have came here twice because the people are so nice and the food is amazing.  Highly recommend this place if you enjoy a local hangout with amazing service and food.

eSx4uqzP5KJih77bHUaiEQ.text: This place is amazing!! The All Day Burrito is mouth watering!! A++++ customer service!!!

Wj6FhWpuyHYYEfxrm0xdHA.text: Very good food had the fish taco and fried shrimp it was very delicious. Servers were fast and friendly and attentive. Drinks are really good we happen to stopped by their happy hours and the drinks were half off. Will return here again next time I'm here in Phoenix.

4aa6jv6UmlNq1BVBmWRdkA.text: Went for lunch and early happy hour from reading reviews on Yelp. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. Cocktail menu was diverse and delightful and the food was over the top delicious! We sat on the back patio and enjoyed a beautiful Phoenix afternoon.

WUDDuRzaS1mf0lfC-PpO_w.text: If you're in downtown Phoenix exploring Roosevelt Row I highly recommend lunching at this spot! The dressing room has some delicious food options including burgers, tacos, soba noodles and more.  Atmosphere: Laid back urban chic or hipster vibe. Music is playing fairly loud. The outdoor area ends with a storage unit modified into a kitchen refrigerator area. Very unique.  Food: delicious!!! I had one Korean skewer and the soba noodle bowl. I would eat this again and I would be willing to try everything else on the menu. They know what they are doing at this place. My boyfriend ordered the fried shrimp and fries along with the homemade pickles, all of which I sampled. The aioli was not spicy but delicious, the way they fried their food tasted amazing. No complaints at all.

fbTmqDYddYCY9cKxoPflPQ.text: Going to lunch on a Friday with coworkers so we wanted something different, unique and close. Yelp brought us to this place. I had the TJ Tacos and they were really good and the creme sauce very tasty, it did just need a bit of sriracha and it was perfect. My coworkers had the classic burger and the All Day burrito. Both of them said theirs was excellent and one of them is a picky eater so it must have been good. I tried the fries that came with the burger and they were great! Salty, but not too salty and a unique flavor that was good. Kinda of a dill flavor but not a pickle flavor. I will get those on the side next time because my fish tacos did not have any. :( The vibe was cool and hip. Loved that you can see them make your food. It was a very small place so it was a bit loud but we could still hear each other talk. The waitress, I dont' remember her name, was a crackup and the staff, over all, were pretty attentive. Definitely will return.

JGqaTKUGKM7QQ-kVwyRc_w.text: I love this place! The shrimp and chips is so good! They have amazing drinks and they're 1/2 off from 11 am - 6 pm. I've tried the C & V Paloma, the Mexi-Cold Brew, Rosemary & the Sage as well as the Peanut Butter Porter and they're all delicious and refreshing. The place is pretty small but I love how cozy and intimate it feels. Great customer service!!!

Nwkc_ROOfVQ0ltUmoLdNgw.text: Stopped in with my boyfriend after finding it on Yelp and was extremely happy with the find! The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The small restaurant had a nice home-y, yet trendy, feel. We had the special of the day, Chorizo Poutine, as well as the RoRo Burger and the beef lettuce cups. The food was delicious and served quickly. We also had a few happy hour drinks and loved them! Better yet, the owner bought us dessert to welcome us into the Phoenix area! The churro ice cream sandwich was to die for! The overall experience was amazing and food can't be beat. It is safe to say we have found our new regular spot!

ZavFiB183uIf112ttrC0vA.text: The best meal I had in Phoenix on my trip! The veggie tacos have such a depth of flavor you don't even miss the meat. The fries have a light seasoning that was very very good!

T9wqcDp_WtaxUqyibUX7MQ.text: Was visiting Phoenix and decided to try The Dressing Room.  The only negative part was sitting right by the door at the bar.  Luckily the cook was very friendly.  The Burrito was good but the salsa was even better.  Would definitely come often if lived in Phoenix.

Qk2CrPOl1-KOp5kw0P_P7w.text: The Dressing room is hands down one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. I'm bummed they don't have anything like this in Utah, where I'm from (Please open one in Salt Lake or Provo, it would kill it).  The RoRo burger is unreal, the drinks are super unique, and the Churro ice cream sandwich is the best dessert I've ever had. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for something new. 10/10

YHX_20Nia2BAJFGlK79aMQ.text: Nice cozy restaurant connected to a get coffee spot next to it. How do I say it was wonderful on the day I visited, perfect weather for outdoor. It was thoughtfully proportioned and along with it a well-balanced cocktail. Our server Adam was terrific and explain the menu to us to suggest which cocktail and dish was right for us. The rosemary and the sage cocktails were my fav.

vnvsh6nTnEs1ZauSAcSfGQ.text: Really enjoyed this place. The burger was fantastic. I was a little reserved about the English muffin since I am not a big fan. However, this muffin is a cross off English muffin and a great hamburger bun. It's larger than a typical English muffin with more soft and spongy perfect for a super juicy burger. Cheers on a job done so well. In will be back.

lIHbYNFWf1GeQ3s1351FAA.text: Such a cool concept in downtown phx. Street style food. Prices are extremely reasonable for the quality and the amazing service! The falafel wrap is so good, even if you're not vegan or vegetarian (I'm not) I highly recommend. Also the RoRo burger is amazing. So much flavor and the English muffin makes the perfect bun. Drinks are good too, especially the happy hour prices.

UMLUhslMvsKRd1TWCmNQ_w.text: I love this place! The service is phenomenal and so are the food and drinks! My favorite bartenders are Courtney and Adam. I've tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something I haven't liked. Not to mention... their happy hour is from 11am to 6pm everyday!!!

GgYqVkxxAKQBt-XATURTEg.text: Great burgers the manager treated my son and I very well. They made a mistake on my meal  and came back with no charge on my meal. I told I could pay for it and they said no, no charge

7Wdt02YY3vS6yFcKegXXaA.text: Ordered the classic burger with fries. Good customer service. Not a fan of the pickles because it tasted like there's ginger in the pickling juice or of the seasoning on the fries but the fries are good. Really nice waiter and host.

72-_FDQNM1oSQyBJw3Umew.text: Excellent Korean Fried Rice (MUST HAVE AGAIN!). Great little patio out back ... keep in mind the whole place is pretty small.  The beer selection could be better and more local. The burger was over-rated.  We will be coming back again one day.

gAc4lFQKqC67ExM-a-2a3A.text: This place is was one of our favorites ...bummer   I absolutely understand downsizing a menu and the push / pull between having to carry a variety of options and wasting food because you've got some items that don't get consumed before they go bad....trust me I do.   I shop for my own household and often have to throw food away. Every time I do - a little piece of me dies.   I can't imagine what that does to the bottom line for a restaurant. So I empathize with you. That said ... shouldn't the remaining ingredients really shine on the dish?? Shouldn't the few things you do, be done REALLY well??   These avacado's should never have seen the plate...can you honestly disagree with that ?   They were in the ceviche dish that used to bring us to your spot. You know the one ....it had toasted seeds and hominy, pickled onions ...now it's just sad   I'd far prefer paying more for the same dish versus paying the same price for a poor substitute.  You can't win them all...but for a mid afternoon service on a Thursday before dinner this dish simply fell short

lFOrmpcYD-dqfyoF0MWpnA.text: Wow. What a cool space!! The patio with a huge tree is beautiful. Food was awesome. There were multiple things on the menu I wanted to try. Service was great. And like everyone mentioned - great happy hour pricing!

VwhQOQ_JDdnraK0qEK7yLg.text: We are still here! Having a great time. Yesenia is the best, she has been very attentive, made sure the mist and the fan on the patio were pointing our way and gave us great tips on what to order. The fries with tajin are delicious and the ceviche on point. Yesenia made sure we are well taken care of and she does it all with a great smile!

V_yJU59IHKMJGwOTtsNb3w.text: I like this place but perhaps moving from New York/Portland, I find it to be average. The kimchi fried rice is missing the umph, the most important component absent is the kim-chi. The RoRo burger is good though it is messy and tastes a little soggy. Perhaps we just missed the best items on the menu but it will be a while before we come back.

vpWEy4l2Mq0ZVD2GmFqlvA.text: Super disappointed to find the food and service has completely plummeted since they opened. We went here last Sunday afternoon 5/26 and had such an awful experience. I have been meaning to get back to this place after a wonderful experience when they first opened and since I've always recommended and wanted to go back. I was so embarrassed when we took my sister in law. It was some of the worst hipster service and just blah food I've had in a long time.   First, it took about 20 minutes for someone to come over and get our drink order. The cocktail I had was super delicious (one if not the only high note to our experience) but the canned beer my sister in law ordered was room temperature. It took another 40 minutes for them to come back and take our order. I had to go to the girl that was busing other tables to ask if our server could stop by since we were ready to order. I totally get when the place is packed and the servers are visibly busy but the place was really, not that busy. We had to ask for silverware and our second round of drinks and basically beg for someone to take our credit cards so we could get out of there.  The food: My fish tacos were super fishy and way too breaded. There was just nothing great about them.  My husband ordered the burger and seriously the burger we had there when they first opened was one of the best I'd ever had. This one was again just meh with a soggy bun and cold fries.   I hate to see a good place go downhill like this. I hope they vet their servers a bit better and hire people on their staff that actually give a sh*t because the overall feel felt just like that: a bunch of people who didn't give a sh*t. I hope they figure it out and bring back the service and food we used to rave about. Until then, we will not be back.

uiGUmFAp3kmRJInS469COw.text: I'm always looking for a good happy hour gig, and the drinks at the dressing room did not disappoint. I had their HH Old Fashioned, and a Negroni. My hub had a Bloody Mary & a beer. He enjoyed both.  Food: Oh, yea, that....We enjoyed the Bulgogi Gyoza, and the Chorizo Poutine.  We ate all of it. Yum. I felt like, since the Poutine was not discounted for HH, they were a bit skimpy on the Chorizo, but having said that, we did eat all of it!!!! Service was GOLD STAR. It was evident that there is a team ethic in this joint. Our waiter was great, and when he was busy, other staff picked up the slack. One, very kind woman, who may have been a manager, kept coming to the table to make sure that we ere happy. Customer service here was great! Food was prepared well, and the HH drink prices were really reasonable. I will be back. If your goal is to eat inexpensively, the food was not HH prices, but for us, the cost of drinks evened the bill to a very happy munching experience. Increased bar space and more choriz would have landed them a 5 star.

LbdEtV9D6XzHgDhItOyQOA.text: Great new go-to spot when I'm in the area. Stopped in for a late lunch with my family, who were visiting from out of town. We were seated on the beautiful back patio in after only waiting a few minutes. The space is super cool and fun to explore, so waiting wouldn't be a problem even if it took awhile. We shared some apps, had some drinks, and pretty much all ordered the same entrees... fish tacos. Per other Yelp reviews, these were an AWESOME choice. My mother, a fish taco snob, even approved with a 10/10. We will definitely be back for another good time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SME2yJnPPRzPXLGrvRuwPQ.text: Went here for lunch, ended up trying the RoRo Burger. I was blown away with how great of a burger it was. This isn't your traditional burgees though, it's served on an English muffin, with tender belly bacon. To top it all off the spicy Russia sauce is amazing. The flavors just melt in your mouth and I s very filling.  The service was great as well, the young man that helped us made sure to keep the water cups full, it was 115 outside so that was really nice and cooled things off.   Will for sure be going back again! And highly suggest you visit too.

1qpelf7Mx8yFDINrPyFIHQ.text: I was really excited to try the Dressing Room because the menu sounded awesome. The location is awesome and they have a really cool outdoor patio behind the restaurant. We started off with their chorizo poutine which sounded like it would be really good and different but it just wasn't working. They put this chili/tangy seasoning on their fries that I think they should put a stop to asap. I think it completely overpowers the flavor of the fries and anything else that goes on the fries. The chorizo poutine was not exactly what I was picturing. It was more of a chorizo dip over the fries. I did really like the cheese curds though. We also ordered the fried chicken sandwich. I think that the oil that they fried the chicken in was not hot enough because the outside did not get that crispy and you could taste the fryer oil on the coating itself. I just wasn't a big fan overall of the food that we ordered and on top of that the service was pretty slow for it not being that busy. I might come back and try other things on the menu, but I was pretty disappointed with the stuff that I did try.

Gj_2jIcStLY8JUMf6LpADg.text: We discovered this little gem across the street from our AirBnb while in Phoenix for a conference. Out server Ian was incredibly helpful as were were seated in the charming patio in the back. We all enjoyed  Pear Shaped cocktails and delicious shrimp tacos.   We returned the following night for happy hour (with Ian behind the bar) and had Snoops and Donkeys (both were fabulous), and ended up staying to eat Nick's wonderful fried rice. We would highly recommend this spot for the drinks, food and excellent service. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in Phoenix!

f2caC6S5wOhnRs6ba7YH3Q.text: Horrible. Researched a month in advance to find a spot that could accommodate the varying dietary requirements in our party so that we could stop off for a good, quality meal after arriving from a 6 hour Maui flight and was open late enough. After getting in at the airport I called to confirm that they were open til 10, and the gal said yes but that they were filled up inside but had patio seating,  although things may clear out by the time we got there, which was at 935.  Dropped hubby off to get a table while the rest of us parked and he gets told by the hostess/waitress with the Crazy Eyebrows that it's Last Call in 10 mins and that maybe we should go to this other place across the street instead "because they have more choices" even though I had already told her I researched in depth as far as menu goes...as I'm explaining to her that I called beforehand to make sure they were open til 10, she goes "now Last  Call is in 3 minutes" and is just being very rude and giving us attitude, like she had somewhere to go and didn't want to take any more customers. I was THIS CLOSE to popping her on her overdrawn thick eyebrows when we just decided to go across the street to THE WILDERNESS where we were welcomed and had some pretty delicious food!  The Dressing Room needs to learn how to live up to their HYPE and train their staff to be more welcoming and customer-focused!

_wmpqM_wgt70XagtZYdRJQ.text: I really liked this place! Evan and Joseph don't know what common sense is therefore should be disregarded. Joseph, for someone who writes reviews, you would think you'd have the common sense to look up the place you're going to before you go there. That's the point of yelp, so you're complaints about the menu are obnoxious because HAD YOU LOOKED IT UP LIKE EVERYONE ELSE, you would of been able to see their menu. Don't leave bad reviews based on your own diet preferences that could have easily been avoided. Clearly you don't know how yelp or the internet works. As for the veggie tacos, which I ordered (heyy vegetarians!) they're delicious. It's not a blob of cheese. They come topped with the avocado crema, pico de Gallo, Peruvian corn, and YES, those are sweet potatoes. Also clearly stated on the menu. All of the flavors paired really nicely, and the cheese wasn't cold AT ALL. The fries get a lot of hype here and I can see why, they were perfect. The avocado crema (that Evan whined about not standing out) I thought was great. How high were your expectations for avocado... and sour cream? Our waiter answered all of our questions, which we didn't have many of considering the menu isn't very big and if you can read it's pretty self explanatory.. he gave great drink recommendations and sat at the table next to us to take our order rather than stand above us. Appreciated, great demeanor. The waitress who seated us was very friendly as well and even answered questions for some visitors walking down the back alley who after that came in to eat. The music in the background was really fun as well, I definitely recommend stopping by if you're visiting the area or if you're just looking for a place to pop In for lunch. They've got one of the best happy hours I've seen, EVERYDAY 11-6 and the entire staff smiles and greets you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie tacos and fries with avocado crema
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get the pear cider! 6.9%

g5Tb0V8bmGPhRFV5Z-Nvig.text: The ambiance is very hipster with amazing cool hip retro all-of the above. The decor is thought out well as being attached to a museum that included a room full of plants. We were greeted with a friendly face and also with a friendly service. Our server was very informative when it came to drinks. Although I am not a vegan but my girlfriend is, our server was able to provide us with vegan options. Shrimp taco was fresh and vegan taco was flavorful. The waitress mentions they wanted to add a beer batter avocado taco to the menu which we would love to try so hopefully this maybe added soon. We hope to return soon to try the newly added beer batter avocado tacos.

ECBIV5WudJOhDgW33_fT5Q.text: I came here for an early lunch by myself during the week and was greeted by the friendly staff. It was pretty cool they had a nice back patio area for seating and was connected to a coffee place, art gallery, and greenery shop. The atmosphere was hip and laid back. The place was very clean and the service was quick and friendly. The menu is short and sweet, but with creative twists and flavors. I had the RoRo burger and fries and was blown away! Definitely a cheat meal/ very heavy, but worth the splurge. Super juicy and saucy. The English muffin bun definitely makes the burger hold up well. Fries are crispy, fresh, and the chili salt seasoning made the meal extra fun. I ordered the Korean yakatori  meal to go for the hubby and loved it! Will Be back to check out the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0HP2G6Ck1Z_oVyYj6GSEkg.text: We are from out of town, California Bay Area.  We happened to stumble into the Dressing Room! What great luck!  The service was top notch, the music hip and fun, the food delicious. The menu was simple, clean and prices were too fair for the quality of the food and service.  The mixed drinks they serve are perfect and tasty!  If you are looking for a break from the mundane, go here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome decor, different.

6ZvpRVKfbqH74BdI6zDPOQ.text: Those of you who follow my reviews know that I do not like paying for atmosphere when I'm buying food, but I'm going to make an exception this time - this is place is cool.  It's like eating in an art gallery (in fact, it IS eating in an art gallery). It is interesting and fun. Our visit came at the end of a long day and we were very quickly comfortable and relaxed.  The menu is limited but everything we had was healthy and yummy.  My burger was served on fresh bread. My salad was fresh. They have a small but good selection of beers on tap. To be honest, none of the food was particularly memorable, but it was healthy and filling. The (salt and vinegar?) fries were a bit too sour, but everything else at our table was fine. Cost was reasonable - they could mark it up more to reflect the atmosphere, but they don't, which is admirable.  I'm only giving them four stars though because they are trying just a bit too hard to be trendy - Portland style. I really don't need to hear the whole story of where every component of my meal came from. Just tell me what's good and I'll give it a try.

zS_W9-sFoEuiL0f9YbCc2A.text: Still GREAT!best fries in town. They make their own potato chips too. Servers managers cooks everyone amazing. A lot of locals and people from word of mouth. Part gallery coffee shop resteraunt what more can u ask. Give it a shot (If u haven't already) its,well worth it.

8qyIqYgwAK9nngxsfeOMYg.text: One of the best spots in Phoenix. Everything I've had here is excellent and the cocktails are perfectly crafted. The outdoor seating is very intimate and feels very upscale.  My favorites here are the RoRo Burger and the all day breakfast burrito. The garlic aioli here is super addictive- this place is permanently in my rotation of go to restaurants in Phoenix.

9sjpzDg9Iz4toepAVKxtIg.text: So let's start off with Peruvian corn. I'm doubtful they are buying it fresh on the cob.  It seems like a fancy name for hominy I know isn't. And I know the chef probably pulls his hair out when guys like me call it hominy, but, Peruvian corn is kind of a deal to get... kind of. ANYWAYS... This place is really cool. It's a hip location on or near Roosevelt Row, or whatever they are calling that Roosevelt area now. At 1st I was a little worried about it being a hipster hangout that was too cool for a dad in his 40s... but I was wrong!!! I mean it IS too cool for a dad in his 40s BUT they didn't care...  They have a nice little menu. The place is clean and the staff is beyond friendly! God that makes a huge difference!!! Yeah, I'm talking to you LUX. What a novel concept to have your employees actually seem HAPPY to see customers! The other nice thing is they have an easy to pronounce menu! Veggie Tacos. How easy is that. Veggie Tacos. I was at a place last week and they has a dish call Colachita... Cola Chita? Co La Chita. Co Lachi ta? I wanted to try it but didn't... I'm perfectly capable of making ass out of myself. I don't help from some trendy menu.  Moving along The veggie tacos are really, really, really good. Like great. I'm impressed. IDK if I'm impressed with the fact that the chef makes everyone call him "Chef", but whatever. Some people need that. If it's just in front of guests I suppose I get it.  So to summarize this long winded A.D.D. review, go there and check it out. Definitely and cool little place.

nPLpOGRkS6o6-hUElIh0ag.text: Went here for happy hour while waiting on our flight. Service was okay seeing as we sat out on the patio. Pear cider was good.

huRzM3t5ve-gi3miJK6ZfQ.text: Absolutely love this place! Any time I have a meeting DT I schedule it around having lunch here! The skewers, veggie and fish tacos are all AMAZING! I love sitting at the counter and chatting with the chefs. The staff is so warm and welcoming, you get the opportunity to talk to everyone. The space is small with a great patio. I cannot wait to try everything on the menu. Oh and they have Happy Hour all day! Please open is south Scottsdale ASAP!!

rp3T8naAEhz29pUT7BiEhA.text: Best lunch I've had in a long, long, looong time. Only thing better than the food was the service...or was the food better? Honestly, this place blew my mind. I love it when places have focused, small menus where each item is fantastic. There is no point having a 30 options if they all blow donkey d. 10 items and each is fire. God bless y'all. We'll be back fo sho.   If you're stupid enough to pass on the ice cream sandwich, it will haunt you.

VrxrRt_Vf1HrxHDTw2GMPg.text: This place is so amazing. The food has been incredible. We had the French Fries, OMG you have to have there fries if you come here.   Next we have the veggie tacos. Again, just blown away at how yummy and just perfectly presented. These folks are rock stars with the food and beverages.   I started out with the seasonal draft. It was really good. My fiance ordered this new drink, a cocktail they just invented, Winter Collins. You just have to come here and experience it yourself.   You will not be sorry!  Some place do a well job. This place knocks the ball out of the park. Total home run!  Last but not least....yeah there is more. The home made churro and ice cream sandwich is to DIE for. Oh my god, I am so in my happy place right now and I'm not a big dessert fan but they once again are rock stars.

5XkA4RgAFLV6crWLvnEpbQ.text: Superb atmosphere! Discovered this place with some of my coworkers and what a find. The drinks were amazing, the appetizers were delicious and my fish tacos were the truth Lol! I've told several friends about this place, even my daughter so she could go with her ASU crew!  Great scenery on the patio and nice music selection. My new spot!!

aCOrYPnzzApLPiiYmpKQiQ.text: The Dressing Room is a must see for the modern Phoenician Hipster. When one walks in they are met with a typical New York over priced hole in the wall, but with just a few more steps you are led into an industrial art gallery for your viewing pleasure while you wait. When you are taken to your seats, you find that it's not over priced at all. It's small menu makes quick of a usually long and arduous process of food selection. Like the art gallery the food was nicely arranged, pleasing to the eye and tongue. Additionally, the mood was set by the authentic Arizonan table cactus (watch out folks, they really poke), distressed wood tables, and sliding barn doors. Buckle up, what a culinary adventure this one is.

fqbkfZCyv8WC5EOIV4L_yQ.text: Had dinner here last night with 3 other people and we all raved about our food all night. We had the veggie tacos, classic burger, roro burger and the yakatori skewers. Everything was so well seasoned, the atmosphere was hip and friendly and the drinks were strong! It is connected to an art gallery so you could walk around if you chose.  The veggie tacos (what I had) were delicious. Fried cheese! So bomb! 10/10 would eat again.

8q1h7a_AAOIun-lBdLa2Cg.text: If you have a small menu, you have to do it right... and The Dressing Room does it right! This was only the second time we ate here and it was as good as we remembered. It's a small place with an open kitchen and a very chill downtown Phoenix vibe. Our server, Taylee, was great, super attentive and very sweet. The drink menu is brief, but good, interesting drinks without going too wacky. And the food... oh the food. I think the RoRo burger is my favorite burger in the valley. Perfect combination of tang, spice and a delicious patty. The fries are cooked so well and have a very interesting and tasty seasoning. You can order them with an aioli that takes it to another level. The only dessert option is the churro ice cream sandwich. It is so good that you won't want any other option anyway. Two cookie shaped, well made churros with delicious ice cream in between. Basically, I'm already dreaming about going back!

DQYf2Wk5Gg6MZx4eq-6HEQ.text: Super hip little space connected to other restaurant. Immediately was greeted and asked if I needed help. All staff was on it and super nice.  Hidden gem in Phoenix. I got the shrimp and chips for my trip back to LA. Yum. Fast and looks like a place I wouldn't mind having drinks at.  If ever back in Phoenix I'll make a stop at this cute little place.  Oh and super clean!

gYBW6TTh1z0lWszRsU6Ulw.text: This is the second visit here and it was just as good as the first.  I got the Roro burger.  It was cooked perfectly....so juicy.  The pork belly and Russian dressing was a great mix of savory and acidic.  I was skeptical about the English muffin for a bun, but it really worked well.  The fries were cooked to a nice crispness, but were a bit over seasoned.  Overall I would recommend a stop at this friendly little diner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eOtQnUoUA-a31_JBCkkuGQ.text: This restaurant was everything the reviews said. The food was amazing. I got the fish tacos and they were so good and filling. I ate some of the fries from my husbands plate and the seasoning they put on them was so good. The service was fantastic. Our server answer all our questions and made some excellent recommendations. My three kids even loved the food. Definitely would eat here again if we come back to Phoenix and I would recommend anyone. So yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Mv3uUc0Zw7RzNMUXuZtqug.text: It's great what they have done sith this spot, which was a gay hustler bar a long time ago, then sat empty for many years. They decor is modern yet maintains the rustic appeal of the original building. The far wall they have opened up into the adjoining space, which includes seating in the art gallery and allows ventilation and sound dispersion. Brilliant!  The service was very friendly and unpretentious. Great music. The Roro burgers and fries were exceptional and fresh. The draft beer and cocktail selection was also great for such a small place. The enclosed back patio, adjacent to the food-prep trailer, would be great during cooler weather. Overall, this gem is a great addition to the Roosevelt Row area.

_0uGz77Q4Uw4U63KxAXCvA.text: Love this place. The drinks are awesome and sitting outside under the trees is amazing. The burgers are great. Fish tacos were also great. Attentive staff. Great downtown addition.

KgzrRyqPcVfMRWyE-qFglg.text: I LOVE meat. So don't ask me to explain why I ordered the Veggie Tacos. All I can say is YUM good. Fun place, great service. Just do it! Oh, really great drinks as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun artwork!
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Tacos.....SUPER YUM!

YDAg7fNxhld0NS2hkXYRhA.text: Highly recommend!  We celebrated birthday dinner with the family on the patio, which included a fussy baby. The staff was super friendly and very accommodating. The menu is small, simple and easy to order! Everyone enjoyed their drinks & dishes which included a cheeseburger w fries meal and fish tacos! Both were really good! Ryan, THANK YOU for frequently checking on us throughout the evening. Our waitress (sorry! Forgot her name!) was super friendly and attentive, thank you for taking care of us!!!! It's a baby/kid and pet friendly place!!! Yay!! We will definitely return and bring our friends next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday dinner with the family on the patio

3CFGrLYAg7NeBSlOJGPKaA.text: Wow! Where to start. Kat was my guide from when I walked in. With a few questions she walked me through the short and thoughtful menu and helped me select a fantastic lunch. Ceviche & Tostada followed by Korean Yakatori beef. Her beer knowledge is amazing and with some samples she helped me find 2 drafts and a can... did I mention it's happy hour from 11am-6? A generous tip is a must because it's a ballet of cooperation among the staff. They keep it casual and conversational while turning out fantastic food. You can tell they each care about everything that passes over the counter. Order anything that catches your eye and don't fear asking for help.   Let them challenge you with drinks you didn't know existed. Peruvian, Filipino, Portlandian, German? Get crazy, they are ready.

TIOPPk9gg6o2J4QkIpSsZQ.text: I would like to give this place another star, but after going there a number of times I'm kind of bored with their menu. For what is there, it's decent, but I think I'm going to take a break from going here for a while. I do enjoy the cocktails. I just wish the food would step up a little bit. There are lots of great places to eat downtown I wish that the dressing room would switch up their menu a little bit.

ZmdOrsziGH6PL6m68yB0Qw.text: We are visiting from out of town. A friend of ours lives right around the corner from the dressing room. We had drinks and lunch there and were very impressed with the food and service. It was small and personal. I definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for  a great burger and some delicious drinks!:)

zVuUg9k5dIW4JNciJWXSrQ.text: Cool place in Arts District. I ordered the RoRo Burger and it was excellent. Parking is confusing but I'm sure for a local it's obvious parking is out back. The seating is limited but that adds to their charm. Beer selection also was diverse. I enjoyed the Pizza Port IPA.

4RVFURRT_5dB3suupMm4ig.text: Loved this place!!!! The drinks are amazing and the food is really good!. Keke deserves a raise!!! And she didn't even help us, she was cooking everyone's food! Great place altogether, even though it's small inside

ZafxDFlhjxyhqd5OSGp90A.text: It was our first time in this part of Phoenix. We were just passing by and didn't even have a chance to check on Yelp for any references about this place. So, our opinion was not affected by any one or anything. Place has very urban dwelling industrial vibe. We were seated in the backyard. There is a kitchen in the back which is made out of shipping container. But do not take me wrong: there is nothing tasteless about this place. As the matter of fact every single detail and corner was thought through. Even bathroom has absolutely groovy details and fixtures.  Service: friendly, accommodating and very fast.   There were customers that were obviously return customers. They would order food right away without even looking at the menu. So, we didn't know what we are getting ourself into and took a leap of faith. My hubby ordered RoRo burger, my daughter ordered shrimp and chips, I ordered TJ Tacos and Cold Soba Salad.  All portions were great size. Just a salad for me would be plenty, we splinted. TJ Tacos between all of us because I just couldn't eat everything myself :) Everything was very very very fresh and flavorful. We are definitely coming back! See my photos. You will not be able to resist it. Great find on our part! Great lunch. See my other review for the coffee shop next door to this place. Also worth your time and attention.

_1mUau4C1Cg5kTTzcUXrDg.text: Hello my name is Justin, I had the best experience with Dressings Room. Food was amazing, staff Katie, Sam, Malone were awesome, and the environment is so good. I'm coming back Friday for more! Check this place out if you're in downtown Phoenix.

WFklm1MZxlCpy-swjtXApA.text: I was really excited to try out this venue. I had heard nothing but great things. I invited a friend of mine who's now writing for a local food column and i though she'd enjoy. I arrived 15 min early to have a beer and i sat at the bar and was politely greeted by some awesome guys who seemed to be working the grill station and another making drinks, he got me two waters and went though the beers with me, I'm a fan of sours so the boisenberry suited me well. He has asked a server to get me menus but she seems extremely disinterested so much to the fact she gave me two drink menus and not food. After borrowing a menu from the gentleman next to me my friend arrived. Our server checked on everyone around ya but never spoke to us again, she finally came back directly infront of us to get something and we asked if we can order she responded with " what do you want " in an extremely annoyed tone. After bringing us our food, she never came back to see if we needed anything. Never refilled waters and never asked if i wanted another beer. It was just absolutely embarrassing. I finally asked my friend if she was ready to go and she said she was still hungry so she waited for the server to arrive again and she asked to see a food menu, the server brought a menu and the bill!! She was pretty much telling us to leave. My friend was completely taken back and felt as if we weren't wanted there. Not to mention it's a middle eastern woman and an African Americans woman visiting this establishment, and the most upsetting part about it is seeing my friend visibly welling up with tears with how this server has treated us... the server comes backs and we have both placed our cards inside the folded bill she gave us. And she left one card there and sped off with one.. she comes back and i kindly asked if she split the bill. She rudely reaches over and snatched the second card she left said she would void the transaction and run both cards... my friend began asking her for the receipt for the voided transaction and she just walked away!! Sent over some guy who explained he just refunded her half the amount and charged the other card which was completely fine but it was the way the female staff treated the two of us that was NOT. Prior to her inserting herself into the situation I was having a really good experience. Not quite sure why she was so unbelievably rude to my friend, and I hope she doesn't treat any other patrons that may not look like her typically customer in a rude manner. The two stars is for the falafel gyro and fish tacos other than that. Pfff!

mLNJ3KbUBlFdPjR3-h-Z1Q.text: Delicious food, friendly service. The burger was awesome. Highly recommend!

pWsSckQGu9k2bj4NUZKGCw.text: So-I'm here on a conference and we came over for happy hour.  Best drinks-best snacks and food. I would recommend the shrimp and fries. Yum.

wX46HG2oWiqadaKTL0DBdA.text: I came in today while in Phoenix on business. It was across the street from where I was staying. It's a little place that doesn't look like much from the street but don't let that stop you. It's got a great feel and the staff is great. The All Day Burrito was one of the best things I've tasted and the salsa that came with it is a must. Something else I appreciated was that upon returning after paying my tab the gentleman addressed me by name and thanked me for coming in. I don't know why more waitstaff and restaurants don't do this. It's a little thing that makes a big difference, and I appreciated it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f2MjuXe_wRyY_DskDZuuTA.text: I've only been to the bar here but I like the concept because it is connected to a gallery, has some outdoor seating, and seemed like a nice atmosphere.

SNDdt1LGNpZH7l-4URrZuQ.text: Fantastic restaurant! The service was on point from the moment we walked in, everyone was so friendly! The food was delicious and unique in a classic sort of way, we could not have had a better experience than we did! I will absolutely be recommending this grub hub to all my friends!!   Thanks again for the amazing food and service!

ewU03AZ-3sH34I-XLyduxw.text: In town for conference, I had no idea where to go for first night's dinner. I chose the dressing room because of the distance from my hotel and the great picture of the staff arm in arm. I was able to get a great table outside to watch the sky change as I ate. Waiter was very helpful in helping me too select a beer that was not bitter. I got the TJ fish tacos and love them. The staff was incredibly attentive and the atmosphere was perfect for a single lady like myself and the many small groups that I saw. I look forward to visiting The Dressing Room again the next time I'm in Phoenix.

rO6DgeLSa678ryutQY6nPw.text: Really good! I tried their TJ tacos and they where awesome! Also the happy hour is every day which is definitely a plus! Will definitely return:)

2ZPjuC7nZJXVx0--P4ctGQ.text: This place was so cool! The outside ambience was sting lighting, a trailer where they prepare the food, a colorful mural, and tables and benches with umbrellas. It was one of my favorite stops on my 27 hour road trip. The food was so good and affordable. The shrimp with the shrimp and chips was battered lightly and fluffy. The food was great portions. My sister had fish tacos and loved it. The waiter was friendly, efficient, and patient. I did get the signature churro ice cream sandwich. It was not my favorite but who cares this place rocks. Service rocks. Food rocks. Phoenix has a scent jem. The inside was tiny and reminded me of a speak easy. They have outdoor bathrooms. You should try it!

WkDBgbc6H5mT4htzRZewig.text: The best happy hour and prawns with fries I've ever had!! I've been here a ton and love the staff and service. Definitely try out some of there drinks.

u2grAxxLtMvivt4wfl8ZZQ.text: Good food! Menu is a bit limited on food but other than that everything was great. Service was good as well. I will go back for drinks only on patio when it cools down.

LqNteR8pg_HIHEOj0sV84A.text: Great place to try different things because this place is different. We sat at the bar and watched them cook all the meals.  My wife had the fish tacos. They were excellent. I had the Korean pork fried rice. It was supposed to be a little spicy so I asked for it to not so. I'm not a fan of spicy foods. However I wish I hadn't asked because I think I could've handled it. The food was awesome. Then we had the churro ice cream. Made right in front of us. It did not disappoint. This is a neat place tucked away. Find it and try it!

bQXGKuUtz5vXe8lgZXSHmg.text: Wow.  We toured downtown last week and ate and drank along the way for a whole afternoon. Hands down, this is the place that stuck in our minds as the place we'll come back to again and again. The food, drinks, service (Kevin, thanks!), were awesome! And the happy hour was probably the best we've found in the area so far. Next time in the area, we're goin back.

_4oHRHPQaqNlCH-uuWJVIw.text: My husband and I were thrilled to find this place! We stopped in for dinner and drinks before a concert at the Van Buren. We were greeted promptly as we entered and were offered seats either at the outside patio or small bar area. We chose the seats at the bar and oredered the Rosemary and Sage and Old Fashioned. Both were superbly made by the friendly bartender, Kevin. We decided on the Korean Fried Rice and Roro Burger and split both. The rice was delicious but a little spicy for me and the Roro Burger was outstanding. The Burger comes with fries which were also very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RQ7A7py6XHd1vAqQmQNwkQ.text: Finally made it to the latest iteration of The Dressing Room! In a past life, it was a dusty parking lot and a rehearsal space for local indie bands. It retained the same name, but like everything else around here, you couldn't tell it wasn't part of Phoenix history.   Yes, 2010 feels like history to me.   Anyway, I visited with some good friends and decided nothing was more apt than the RoRo burger. Don't let the fact it's on an English muffin fool you--it is a formidable portion. And although I was left wanting for the 'buns' on this to be a little more toasty, and the dish itself a little less juicy--it was just fine. Step aside, cheddar, Gruyere may be the ideal cheese for burgers. The fries tasted faintly of chili and so strongly of lemon you may pucker. I haven't had any like them, but they are thoroughly enjoyable nonetheless.   You won't be disappointed with the brief cocktail menu (get The Snoop!) or beer rotation. You definitely won't be disappointed with their modest prices--much of the menu is under 11 dollars for a great meal. With the weather cooling down, treat yourself to a nice, casual dinner on the patio. I doubt you'll leave with any regrets!

TybyouwxUqml3bXOjxjTWA.text: I had shrimp tacos, and the RoRo Buger Everything was so delicious I was so sad when it was gone. The customer service is great, and thay are really fast I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

tvAOJoBzdmw_Jo6DoWhyVA.text: When you stumble upon The Dressing Room, you're in for a treat! Including the Beer Battered Queso Oaxaca Veggie Tacos! There was SO much flavor in these tacos the only thing else I needed was, French Fries. Yep! Ask for a side of Peanut Sauce to do some fry dipping.  Perks: Super Friendly Staff, Happy Hour, Patio, Affordable Vegetarian Options.  The Dressing Room  - 220 E. Roosevelt St., PHOENIX, AZ, 85004 - 602.777.0763  Eating Out With A Girl #EOWAG #EatingOutWithAGirl

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eating Out With A Girl + The Dressing Room

2YTr1dC5ZylqrzELNXBHzw.text: Get the BURGER. Period. Full stop. We have eaten a lot of burgers in our lives and I can say without any hesitation this one was in my top 5 hands down. Did we order other stuff? Sure we did whatever it was it was grossly overshadowed by the deliciousness of the burger. Why was it so good you ask? The meat was well seasoned, well cooked the English muffin toasted and delicious the ratio of bread to burger etc I could go on but why? Just go and get the burger! The place is a little Hole in the Wall nothing fancy but totally worth it!

D6mMjsej86NAtbwLdot-iA.text: Such a cute atmosphere. Small dining space however so there was a long wait. The food makes up for it! I had the fish tacos and Roro burger. They were amazing! The fish was perfectly cooked and the breading was light and fluffy. The burger had such a unique flavor. Absolutely loved it! Definitely returning here soon

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos

x0riRIeb_qpS9r5IPdnOrw.text: Need a place to dip in for a drink and bite to eat?? Don't settle for the uninspired..... come to the Dressing Room!! Casual, fun, great drinks and fantastic food. Leave with a happy mouth Drinks: Pear Shape and The Snoop App: Chorizo Poutine Lunch: Korean Fried Rice  So happy!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

54ilCPQERUzvOlfqIDBFtQ.text: The inside of this place is really small, but intimate and perfect for one on one's with friends or a significant other. They have more of an outside space than an inside.   I ordered the cocktail, Rosemary & the Sage, and my friend order the Spiked Chai. If you like bourbon with an added sweetness, I would suggest the Rosemary & the Sage, and if you like a creamy cocktail that reminds you of your daily coffeeshop order, I suggest the latter.   For food, I ordered the Cold Soba Noodles. Wow - it was so good. The bowl had (obviously) soba noodles, a soft boiled egg, grated carrot, some slices of avocado, red cabbage, snap peas, and seaweed. All the flavors blended really nicely together.   The server accidentally gave us another table's check, but once he realized he gave us a refund and our actual check back. The waiters were really kind and handled the situation very well.  Side note: The way I tell that a restaurant is a place I want to go back to is how clean the restroom is. It was clean and modern, and 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NT2BgE3Xudu0ABi0wj_WMQ.text: Visiting on business and read the reviews on yelp. Really neat little place with a unique but good menu! Don't forget to order the churro ice cream!

FwgMkeMYRKEYPTAlRmM8ow.text: Great place.  Great food, super flavorful and inventive.   Tacos, burgers and sides are awesome!  Service is fast and attentive.   Would highly recommend the stop

iegkjWGuqPpwFHBJ1B6j6A.text: What a nice place! Really enjoyed dinner with a friend to catch up. The All-Day-Burrito was simply amazing! And the staff was quick and very nice. Loved the look and atmosphere!

ItFWe3JuoBLeHNs8iXC1nw.text: This appears to be a hip spot near downtown Phoenix for the foodie types. I did not care for the menu choices hence my low rating. Quality is probably better than here stars, but I was not interested in returning after my dinner. I do not eat cows, and I was not in the mood for seafood, so I was stuck with some veggie tacos.   Your best bet is to come with a mild appetite and someone you would like to have a few cocktails with. If you can drink and split a basket of fries, you might love the place. Fries here are among the best I ever ate -- crispy, well seasoned, and appropriately splashed with tangy vinegar.   The tacos I had were not good. There was a fried block of cheese in each one. They were filled with chunks of sweet potato, or at least I think it was.   The patio was delightful with flora and art. There is a gallery of some sort attached to the indoor seating area with a coffee shop in between.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xOGJ3F1g-5xPvAhu_POWlA.text: The burger was very popular. I heard several people ordering it so I had to taste for myself. The Bloody Mary's are tasty with a little spice and a Tajin rim, the fries with Tajin are a must try! We loved it. I'll be back to taste some of the other offerings...

SBQZ9h8C1Uid8Ux2jTmKzA.text: Food is amazing! Can't recommend the All Day Burrito enough! Roro burger is also delicious! Great happy hour with great mixed drinks!

-GbCwnjbuLDy0_OyZcdNGg.text: Very fun place downtown.  They only have one vegan entree and it's the falafel with no tzatziki sauce and french fries, but it was good.  It'd be nice if they had a little tahini or something to make it less dry.  The drinks are really good and the atmosphere was nice and the service was really good too.  I probably won't be coming back very frequently without more vegan options, but it was a very good place for a group of people and the non-vegans in my group really enjoyed what they had.

t2YOsWv_ad1gmlduHm4NwA.text: Stopped in for a drink on Saturday night around 8pm. Not a lot of seating, but we found 3 spots at the bar. The staff is very engaging and welcoming! Drinks are on point and very creative! We had already eaten, but couldn't resist a churro ice cream sandwich after we watched the Churros being made fresh right in front of us!   We were also informed Happy Hour starts every day at 11am. We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Donkey

dwKF_o-t5lyChuXTNVrMKg.text: We have been to the dressing room a few times over the last year. We somehow always end up getting the same things drinks and fish tacos! During our last visit we got some fries that we really enjoyed. They were crispy and had a unique light lemon flavor. The drinks are innovative and layered with a complex flavor profile. My favorite beverage is the peppered flower. The gin and elderflower go lovely together and when blended with egg whites the texture becomes so creamy. We got the fish tacos and shrimp with chips. I was a little dissatisfied with the shrimp, It was beer battered and fried however not very crunchy. The aioli served with it was ok, but the spicy Russian dressing is to die for. We always ask for it on the side. It's creamy and spicy and complements everything.

R25J5gIJ3zmjmyKka_KYGQ.text: I have had my eye on this place for awhile...not gonna lie it was solely due to I heard they had a churro ice cream sandwich. So we sat on the patio, and it's got a really cool urban vibe, I over heard someone say it's called the dressing room because it used to be a dressing room for a drag show/bar which I thought was cool. Now to the good stuff...the menu is small but I feel like they are very creative and what they do have they do extremely well .....consistency is key  I had the classic burger and I didn't have time to take a picture because I was busy stuffing it in my face, it was delicious. I also had the spiked chai which was also very good...and very strong  my husband had the big burrito..eggs, bacon, potatoes, corn and cheese...he was in heaven...all his favorite things in burrito form. Last but DEFINITELY not least, the churro ice cream sandwich....I can only say it's a delicious experience....that's it no other words. Run don't walk to the dressing room, you can thank me later.

n1gNL0CEDOgti6_l3abNaA.text: New favorite little spot in downtown phx!! The staff was so nice and the whole atmosphere was just very laid back, but upscale. Mack was our server and he was great. Zack, the manager came and chatted with us for a min as well which after working in the food industry for a while I appreciate when this happens. It's rare these days.  THE FOOD! So delicious!! We had the TJ tacos and it's fair to say they are my favorite fish tacos I've ever had. The fries? Amazing. Shrimp and chips? A must have. Even the Korean Skewers blew me away. Seeing as that's half the menu right there, it's safe to say you can't go wrong with any of the food, or beverage, items here. I'm already looking forward to going back.

SrCK2tBkK9QiCwiJlZhFzQ.text: Best burger seriously in town - Great patio great beer (peanut butter - yes! Amazing) - homemade fries homemade chips ---- the extreme bomb! This place is 5+ - just hard to find - go around and park off of 3rd st off the road. Seriously amazing!

JulZ1UNfqYZVSEmCXhjbjA.text: Spending the day in Phoenix. Came across this wonderful quaint restaurant. Everyone was sooo nice, the atmosphere was great, and the food was delicious. Highly recommended!

Z_Z2QV3jIpzZHldesr1AYQ.text: Such an amazing gem!  Happened to stop by for their crazy happy hour and enjoyed delicious cocktails for half price as well as extremely well prepared, tasty food. Limited menu but what they do offer is done so well.

EkqGIYvJlFicrpSyRq44MA.text: Impressed with this little joint. Came here late night and had some great tasting bloody Mary's... Tacos are great and portion size was respectable.   I will be back soon.   - Alfie

FTh9puR4lH1axLOqXQ4Ssw.text: Just came back from a Friends and Family celebratory opening. The Dressing Room has a cool vibe, the indoor seating holds about 12 and they have a wonderful patio seating out in the back that holds 40.  My friend Victoria and I had their green tea iced tea, C&V Paloma (absolutely delicious!!!), Chicho Morado (an unique purple corn diffused drink- very refreshing!), cold soba salad, Korean style yakitori & TJ taco.   We ate family style & shared everything. The food concept is "global food truck" and there is a bit of something to appeal to everyone's tastes. It's simple and fresh. There is very little chance of not getting a good meal with a concept like this, executed by a friendly staff is sure to make this restaurant a local favorite and a place to stop on First Friday's.    Roosevelt Row is on an upwardly trend and the Dressing Room is a perfect addition to the area!

F6ugPvYmPbV0lRuIIXBAuQ.text: The food is really good here! I had the Roro Burger and was awesome! It was the best burger I've had in awhile. The service was great and even though it's hot outside the mist kept us cool and the ambience was nice!

qFkbQUL5-fUIMUyA3-jdvw.text: Luv this little place! The patio is fantastic as well as the music. The menu is short but interesting. I had the roro burger which was 5 star..... the fries were fantastic as well. Paloma cocktail was so tasty loved both of them

jmPmGMvhkpolnJq4OIZSxQ.text: Great place, dug it. Good vibe. The food was good. I had a burger-good (could've kept it a little red for me). Fries were great-crisp. The waiter was really nice and she was attentive. I'll be back for sure to try other menu items.

B3Pu9pEHabssQS5YgM35kg.text: Kudos on the giant Boba Fett painting that greets you when you enter this place! :)  Loved the Peruvian Ceviche Salad and my friend was very fond of her order of the TJ Tacos. Definitely have to go back to try out other dishes and have another go at the ceviche salad - so delicious!

8-wnvRFDhY6uioQtX5szMw.text: Went for dinner on a Sunday with a friend. Their burrito was great! What wasn't great was the service.. it was HORRIBLE. We weren't greeted for 10 minutes. We ordered drinks and food at the same time since we had a while to review the menu. We got our food in decent time but didn't get our drinks until we were almost finished with our food. While there, another table of 5 women got up and left before their drinks came Because the service was so slow. It's a cute atmosphere but I will NOT be visiting there again.

lrDzR6BtWXPwDKVnI5XCiQ.text: First time here and it was delicious! We loved that the burgers came on giant English muffins and the fish tacos were delicious! We sat at the bar and the service was great! They work really well in the small area that they do have! We will be back!

f0oEvXLdTtZHb9Mt4E1YFQ.text: The food was fantastic. Had shrimp & a burger!  Great selection of beer for hubby!  Connor our waiter was great!  Down side was we didn't know where to park because parking named after building and not restaurant.
