eBJG34n7j01FU2RWjlU4xA.text: Seven of us ate here yesterday for lunch. We all ordered something different and it all was super delicious. Max was a fun, informative waiter. The owner checked to make sure we were all happy. Would definitely come back.

i79IZNP3cKXcWW-LADgUGw.text: HIDDEN TREASURE!  Staff is super friendly, drinks are great and the food is the bomb !  Lots of vegetarian options.  I love the all day burrito, but fish tacos are a close second!  Back patio is awesome!

5dUZkYLnVWBr1YTkPSXf7g.text: New spot I found and spent half my Saturday there. I came to BE for breakfast meeting but sat outside on the dressing room side. Perfect weather day to do so and the atmosphere was so chill and quaint. Jacob and the other owner was so awesome to my friend and I. The waitress and waiter were so friendly and quick. I had the classic burger with fries and aioli so delish! Love, love this place and will be hanging out more here. The owners are doing a great job!

CtdW7ngDrCVKZ3CEI5Gfhw.text: Love this place ... churros with ice cream are my perfect dessert .. took family and they enjoy the food .. specially mom. Great patio, great service ... recommended

dB9xBxheoCvb0JwntXXyuQ.text: Great spot downtown on Roosevelt.  Cool vibe, great music. We went on a Sunday afternoon and were promptly seated on the patio.  Happy hour was in play, so I had the Snoop cocktail which was very refreshing.   We ordered a variety of food: RoRo burger, Korean fried rice, breakfast burrito & the egg sandwich.  Everything we tried was fantastic.  I had the RoRo burger and it was delicious...still trying to figure out what seasoning they use on the fries. Yummy!  I will definitely return.

RV1I3Z78iwR-Gr-fuMJIKQ.text: We've been to The Dressing Room a couple of times to hang out and have really enjoyed it! The first time we were there, we didn't realize they have a long Happy Hour (from 11am - 6pm) featuring 1/2 off wine, beer, and cocktails; we've gone back since to take advantage of the deal!  I've enjoyed the C&V Paloma every time - Tequila, Fresh Grapefruit, Lime, Vanilla, and Cinnamon - super delish & quite refreshing especially for the summer! They also have a non-alcholic drink, the Chicha Morada, listed as a Homemade Peruvian spiced purple corn drink which is tasty & also refreshing.  Their food menu is smaller but we've liked the items we've gotten so far - TJ Tacos, RoRo Burger, and Shrimp & Chips. The TJ Tacos have been my favorite; the fish was fried crispy and the cabbage, pico, and avocado crema were the perfect toppings. Highly recommended! I liked the Shrimp due the batter they were fried in but that wasn't my favorite. My husband liked the RoRo Burger, it was packed with the toppings which made it tasty. Their fries are seasoned with tajin & come with a choice of side sauce which are good too!  The only drawback is that the inside of the restaurant is small, not ideal for a large group. They do have more seating on their patio however! Overall, cute little place worth stopping by.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TJ Tacos / RoRo Burger / Shrimp &amp; Chips.

vLelpzxjdmuixVQZBkQavw.text: The Dressing Room is a really good, chill spot for some tacos and drinks. The vibe is a little eclectic and fun. They also have a nice outdoor patio in the back of the restaurant.   I ordered the fish tacos, fries and a Bloody Mary. The fish tacos were pretty good, not the best I've ever had but the fries were delicious. They bring out three types of sauces for the fries and they were all delicious. The Bloody Mary was also pretty good, a little watered down but still good.  The service was really good, and we were there during happy hour so all of our drinks were discounted. 2 meals, and multiple drinks for $35...not too shabby

SRj-2TVQ_Yu0RnsIfgWdbw.text: very impressed with this little place.  We walked over from my friends downtown condo and upon arrival were quickly greeted and seated in the patio.  Our server was great: friendly, chill, and quick.  I had the RoRo burger which was delicious.  That english muffin bread idea is the best ever!  Our tostadas with both the pico and the ceviche appetizers were perfectly crunchy and freshly fried and salted.. yummmm.  My friends cheese tacos were ginormous but they looked very yummy from my angle :P  We had their grapefruit cocktail for $5 which was a SUPER deal.. I think I had two???  I really appreciated that the owner or manager or whoever the two men were, stopped by and not just asked how we were but legitimately had an enjoyable two-way conversation with us... that was really nice to feel that welcomed.    I came back a second time and had the tacos and very very much enjoyed them as a light lunch... we will def be back again, friends!

7xkQP6H4WyE3-tE4Id8RVA.text: We had an event at this venue last Sunday 10/8 "Sunday Bloody Funday". It was partnered with United Blood services, Phoenix Rescue Mission & The Tampon Project . We donated blood, made first Aide kits for the homeless, donated feminine hygiene products for the homeless, wrote Congress on concerns & had a guest speaker Deedra Aaboud talk to us about being a woman in Congress. The event was put on by Babe Council and was from 11-3. The venue spot was perfect for us. It was clean & spacious. The staff was very friendly & the food was delish! We even had our Veuve Rose served. The UBS blood bus was able to pull up right out back for everyone to donate. We are Boss Babes doing Boss Things.....for others! #BabeCouncil2017

uQLcCa-xa1VEHUrwGl6LHQ.text: Delicious food and amazing location.  I highly recommend the All Day Burrito ams TJ Tacos (fish)

_eIpwxWtT5N7AV7FcxQetQ.text: This is a hidden gem in the downtown area. They do happy hour every day and a reverse happy hour during the late night on weekends as well. I've been here on several occasions, mostly on weekends until most recently on a Tuesday. We came for a taco Tuesday celebration and although they did not have any specialty pricing outside of their regular happy hour deals we still enjoyed ourselves. I got the rosemary and sage cocktail which is well balanced between the bourbon and rosemary and not overly sweet or herby. We got a plate of fries for the table with their spicy Russian sauce which was delicious. The fries were perfectly crispy, not overly greasy and seasoned well. The spicy Russian sauce isn't too spicy but well balanced flavor to accompany the fries. As an entree I chose the TJ tacos which are their take on fish tacos which were delicious! They were topped with avocado and the fish seemed to be freshly fried because the tacos were perfect. Been here several times and the TJ tacos never disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fries! Soooo good!
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary and sage
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food menu

mb6TFW_iJmVXFIVdeGh56g.text: I'll talk about food and drinks in a minute, but let me just say we had the most attentive and helpful server ever! He made an average happy hour fantastic.   Anyway, the happy hour deals here can't be missed - half off everything basically - so we stopped by for drinks and a snack before dinner. We ordered the fries which came with a sauce, and the four of us ordered drinks. We particularly enjoyed the spiked chai and the peppered flower, though one of my friends' chai was way too strong (too much rum). We convinced her to ask for a little more chai concentrate to go in it, and our server obliged, which made it much better.   We ordered more fries (they were delicious, but we definitely needed more for the four of us, and the baskets were cheap) and without asking, our server brought us all three sauces instead of just one, possibly because he heard that we could decide which one we really wanted. Overall this was a really great way to spend happy hour with friends. I can't wait to go back.

Fthp_k83mSHUuZeNikE7vQ.text: Located in the heart of DTPHX, The Dressing Room is a bright addition on Roosevelt St. I work nearby and had lunch here on a weekday. We got the All Day Burrito, Cold Coba Salad, and Churro Ice Cream Sandy for dessert. The All Day Burrito was delicious & a good portion size for lunch - not too big or too small - and the salad was also yummy. My fave part though, without a doubt, was the churro ice cream dessert! The presentation was adorable but it tasted even better, especially with the warm churro and the ice cream... YUM.  For a quiet weekday, service was great. There are some seats in the small area inside and a back patio. Parking, like many places downtown, is scarce. There are metered parking on the street or this tiny lot behind the restaurant (less than 5 spots if they're not already taken). My only complaint is that I wish they had a bigger menu with more selections! Definitely wouldn't mind coming back here again to try their drinks and other items.

9kqlYpyrKz6HFDKv68NAlA.text: Went to The Dressing Room on Friday with a friend and we are already trying to figure out when we can go back. Everyone was super friendly, felt like a room full of regulars.   Drinks were strong and wonderful. My burger, on an english muffin, was amazing and the seasoning on the fries was perfect.

9jy4akC2kTzt0gQ31ZW1Jg.text: This is a hit or miss place. Service is down the middle and sometimes can have slow service. Staff is usually really friendly and atmosphere is relaxing and refreshing.   Disappointed in my last visit. Got drinks and food during happy hour and we got our food pretty quick, however our drinks took 30 minutes. I got a passive aggressive speech from the general manager of why it took so long and was not too impressed with drinks. Really strong.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Vc0b4QWoapJamBmY2NGbQw.text: I had a delicious lunch at The Dressing Room on Tuesday! I had stopped into Be coffee, food, and stuff {same owner} to work for a little bit and when I got hungry, decided to try it's BRAND NEW sister restaurant next door! There is a door connecting the two places which it totally cool. I LOVE the decor, cute little patio, and great little bar where you can watch the chefs cook. It is pretty small so not great for big groups but definitely good for a date night or client lunch! They have Happy Hour specials EVERY DAY from 11 AM - 6 PM with half off of cocktails. How can you beat that?! And let me tell you, the cocktail menu looked incredible!   For lunch, I ordered their cold soba salad with a Yakitori steak skewer because they looked so tasty. The salad was nice and refreshing! It had pickled cucumbers, ginger, carrots, onions, sesame seeds, a soft boiled egg, avocado, seaweed, and i'm sure i'm missing things! It was topped with a light miso dressing. It was a TAD fishy for me but this isn't saying much because i'm super sensitive to fishy things. It is probably supposed to be this way! THE SKEWER - YES. The flavor was incredible and I will 100% order these the next time that I come. So yum!   All in all, this is a great new addition to the Downtown Phoenix foodie scene! Definitely pay them a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They have happy hour every day from 11-6 and cocktails are half off!!

ZgLW8T02vr3mHE9EDkV5dQ.text: Ridiculously good!!! One of the most memorable burgers and fries of my life!  The Miso slaw was just ok... was kind of bland next to the RoRo burger but a good palate cleanser none the less.  The service was OUTSTANDING!!! Enough can't be said about Samantha!!! Can't wait to go back and try those tacos!  Omg soooo good!!!!

jczgowbjMEZzSchIdbXvZA.text: Food: TJ Fish tacos and fries with Spicy Russian sauce. The fish tacos were good and the fries were GREAT... the sauce was a nice touch. I'm a huge ketchup fan and didn't feel the need to even ask for any ketchup because the sauce was that good.   I also ordered a gin drink called the The Snoop that was incredibly refreshing with the rest of the meal.   Keep in mind that the fry order is HUGE... so make sure to split it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pth6_p02MO-Z8JEdh0k7LQ.text: The fish taco's are the best! Drinks are different and strong! Service is friendly. Good music in the background to the sounds of The Cure, Depeche Mode, New Order, etc. Very chill spot!

v6O6dOX_FTw_vr6TjWg93A.text: Love this place the patio was amazing and our servers were so helpful and sweet. Food was also delicious and the drinks were bomb.

_60iYqdHJ8RkQ1ve2e6ENQ.text: First time here. Sunday afternoon. Sat on the patio, had the fish tacos. Delicious!!! I'd come back to try more of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TJ tacos - delish!
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RwgfF77hY_mFkOJUH1xgYQ.text: Wow, what a great first impression the Dressing Room made on our entire group. The inside is small and there were no free tables so we sat on the patio. They kept the patio cool with coolers and spritzers so we didn't feel like it was 110 degrees. Our waitress was friendly and offered great suggestions on dishes to try. Our friend ordered the All Day Burrito and absolutely loved it, licked his fingers and was ready to order a second one loved it so much! My husband ordered the RoRo burger with fries and tried one of the fancy dipping sauces. I had the shrimp and chips and found it to be the perfect portion and the shrimps were plump and flavorful. Our other friend ordered the ceviche salad and enjoyed the creative interpretation. Our waitress got busy but received some amazing support from one of the restaurant directors who made our day! the cocktails were creative and delicious. Happy hour prices are amazing. Why are you not here already??

_lD4Uk7HxEc2672lbaqVvQ.text: Bopped in here with only 20 minutes for lunch and boy howdy! The folks over here were SO helpful in getting me my grub kindly and quickly. I had the be Sammy and it was nothing short of delightful. Got a hot coffee I gulped down and then they sent me with a to-go one as I ran out the door to work. The space is darling with inside and outside seating options. I sat at the bar, which is unlike most restaurants as the line/kitchen is on the other side of the bar. Pricing is very reasonable for the quality. Excited for my next visit when I have more time to enjoy the space.

OWsau8W6LviX3z2MosF3_A.text: Amazing atmosphere. I had the pork fried rice and it was a bit spicy but tolerable. I had an amazing server and everyone was very attentive.

ZqiewoQfLSuDg9MgLSPUag.text: THE best happy hour in town and the RoRoBurger is the best hamburger around. Paloma's are outstanding!  Love this place.

aCb3-BPqzWDto8STlCjmQw.text: Loved this place. I had the RoRoBurger and got the fries with Avo Crema. I also had a Chicha Mirada. The burger was fantastic medium rare. The toasted English muffin worked really well as the bun and the flavors came together really well. The place has nice outdoor patio seating. Parking was ample in the back for this area. He interior is shared with a coffee house, plant shop, art gallery, and co-working space. Very interesting concept.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. RoRoBurger: gruyere cheese, gastrique onion, spicy Russian, butter lettuce, on toasted English muffin.

6Jy_Ze6xDMWK_hPhXPVguQ.text: This place is awesome! It's small and cozy and we enjoyed sitting on the patio and watching passersby. Great attention to detail - fresh flower twigs on the tables and speakers in the trees. Staff was friendly and the food was amazing. We got drinks on happy hour -$5 cocktails. We had the whiskey rosemary. It was well made and refreshing. The soba noodle salad was as amazing as the juicy burger.  I loved the English muffin bun. Their fries were also delicious served with specialty dipping sauce. High food quality and reasonably priced. We will visit again.

iEb7r_yeM3dzRmss5MUxjA.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and the staff was beyond awesome! They were all so friendly and made us feel welcomed! The Rosemary & Sage and The Donkey drinks were delicious as well as their Korean Yakatori. At the end of our meal they served us their popular churro ice cream with a birthday candle and even sang a little to my boyfriend. They were all very sweet, playful, and amazing throughout our time that night. I highly recommend coming here for their drinks, food, atmosphere, and awesome staff!!!

GcRAjanEL01D1NgZ0b8Gfw.text: Great ambiance, quick service, not too expensive. Outdoor seating area with cooling mist. Neat coffee shop next door.

7Ir0aUDeXXuf6Sc9rK1XbQ.text: Had lunch here after an amazing aerial yoga session at Elevate Yoga (located in the same MonOrchid building). We shared the Breakfast Burrito with bacon on the side, cold sobs noodles with shrimp, and the ceviche salad. All were light and delicious. And half off all beer, wine, and cocktails from 11-6 daily isn't too bad, either!

ogBzukDh00lzx8HhY6gpSg.text: The customer service and the food was amazing. The environment is nice and relaxed. Really enjoyed my date with my wife there. Also the food was reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend and would definitely be back.

zqfz9n7HTKrq9yTo0wZpVA.text: Awesome! Great atmosphere and the food is really tasty! The menu is very small but the food is always done right. We had the burrito, veggie tacos, and fries. All three were amazing. The servers were super attentive and happy hour drinks are 1/2 off! Recently they extended the seating around the corner into the area occupied by a coffee shop and gallery- good move!

sFOCroQW-xE0ILjcW7BEsA.text: After reading so many great reviews about this I decided to come here and give their famous burger a try but for 10$ for a burger the only thing i liked were the fries and the special sauce they have! My burger was dry and the meat was so thick that you really couldn't conceal the dryness with sauce or anything! Maybe i just got unlucky and had a bad one but I probably wont try their burger again

P1sQQKepJPa7CYsDlAplmA.text: Love the dressing room! What a great addition to the tasty eateries downtown. It was a group of four and we were seated immediately on a Thursday evening. I ordered the breakfast burrito which was enormous and packed with deliciousness. Others ordered the burger which was just as good, fish and chips, and everyone ordered drinks. Drinks were really good and strong. Staff was fast and the manager even came by to thank us for coming. Will definitely be back soon!

Nzc1l2YLbERpAZ7NxrrK_w.text: Had an incredible burrito here. Also LOVE the atmosphere. Too cute. Def hope to come back.

DuWdkXA_SQAvh8qHrtkIHw.text: Bomb food.  Go for Sunday brunch.  Half off booze.  Great service.  Their breakfast burrito and roro burger are both real delish.  Cocktail game on point.  Especially their Bloody

vauGh572A0sKcYXBVTyjtw.text: We were so excited to see another cool cocktail bar open in our neighborhood!  We stopped in for happy hour a few Friday nights ago and had a great experience.  The place is quite small, but we were fortunate to snag a table on the patio.  Their happy hour consists of half off drinks from 11-6 - highly recommend the $5 Donkeys (amazingly refreshing).  We also had a side of fries with the spicy russian sauce...so tasty!

W3qNdWzrvrt3TcRI1GEjXg.text: I love love love this place. The food is amazing and it's a go to date night spot. I've only tried the burger and ceviche and both were delicious. The food is filling and worth the price.

tXpFCIQyOXnr-p9ArLeR8w.text: A cool and intimate spot that makes very tasty gourmet street food! The space is modern and minimal which reminds me a lot of the eateries I like at home. I always order the breakfast burrito with oxaca cheese and sweet potatoes.

l4jpQwd5D5e_aGpV2dCp-g.text: One of my favorite places to hang out...the food is yummy..nothing fussy, but interesting and flavorful.  Great waitstaff and vibe...thank you!!

avbEnKGzZ4_HPzcWhGwY1g.text: The most amazing place ive been to yet, amazing all day burrito, great fries and a fantastic spicy russian sauce to go with them

0Jo9QrkQoAcvDRiCgMg4rQ.text: Amazing happy hour and even more amazing drinks!!!  great place to chill back and relax with some friends on a beautiful sunny Phoenix day!

KWxg1pGs3V4glDncvbPtkQ.text: The food was great, I had the shrimp and chips my husband had the burrito. The restaurant was cute and intimate. My only complaint would be the waitress who ignored our table and we had to find her to bring us the check.

rJoZDqpH46enP30PtsJcDg.text: Awesome place. Small but not cramped, they have a patio. Industrial refurbished interior, and the food and service was superb. Had the Roro Burger, and I will be back, dragging all my family and friends w me.

v-B1TRKqyWEC_OAi7dYCcQ.text: Love this place! It's a new favorite for sure. All day burrito is amazing, I just had it for dinner. Drinks are great, staff is great- it's a great spot to check out, will be coming back again soon!

S19EXicJWx5kkN6VAaFu1g.text: If I could give this place more than 5 stars, I wouldn't hesitate! Definitely a new favorite of mine. The RoRo burger is incredible, and the fries are delicious and creatively seasoned with tajin. They make the spicy russian dressing in house as well as their pickles, which are killer. I didn't try any drinks, but the vibe and service were just as great as the food. This place is super small with a super cool patio. A great new addition to downtown, I just hope I can still get a seat when the rest of you see what I mean!

FWytnKdi_XWAjwmM3f4DAw.text: We were at the Orpheum Theater and hungry when the performance was over.  Looked on Yelp and The Dressing Room came up and we headed for 220 E Roosevelt.  We could not have been more pleased.  The ambience, the food, the service was just what we wanted.

dbPdKquXXA3o3v91kG2y4g.text: Friendly owner and staff, very attentive. Fun atmosphere with amazing street food from all over. Had a Mexican Coke with the fish tacos and a RoRo Burger. Everything was cooked well and they had me in and out of there in 30 minutes

4ltuLqVn8flWrnEQbvSNgA.text: The Dressing Room has amazing food. They serve breakfast all day so we ordered their breakfast burrito and fish tacos to share. Both were amazing but my friend and I liked the tacos slightly better. Seasonings were spot on and the fish was served hot off the fryer. The burritos had tons of ingredients and the crispy bacon inside gave a nice bite to it. Highly recommend both dishes.

Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

aEAZtvlSxhz4v9uvmsLLIw.text: First time visit on Thursday this week! I've been wanting to try it and so happy we made it in.  I had the pork belly fried rice.  The description sounded amazing and I knew I needed to try it. It was excellent.  I can't wait to return so I can make my way through the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love anything with an egg on top!

HVLJ9oTC_VR6fdDI_zF28A.text: Our first time here was amazing! Because the weather was nice out we decided to enjoy our meal in their small front patio and the ambience was amazing! My boyfriend ordered the Tj Tacos while I had the Korean Galbi lettuce! There is no doubt the ingredients used are fresh! The Korean Galbi was phenomenal, it was very tasteful! And the Tj tacos were absolutely delicious as well! Definitely recommend this place!

YAH796b2gHLgbLvXQi1QtQ.text: Literally, I have no idea how many time's I've driven past this place without noticing it before finally going for a group event. I mean, has it been there just a matter of days? Weeks? Even years? Regardless of how long it's been, I'm sad it took me as long as it did. Dressing Room combines inspiration from around the world (at least I counted Korea, Canada, the States, and Mexico, which is still broad by any measure) to create fanciful, fun, and, most importantly, delicious snacks, meals, and drinks.   As for ambiance, the small front patio is tastefully done and the location is hard to beat.  Pro-tip: park on Portland, which is only one block north, to avoid paying for parking.

prQIJEhx9hGeQS3Bsgyatg.text: I was in Phoenix for 1 week and ate here 3 times. This place is so good! I was going to the coffee bar next to it each morning and decided to give it try for lunch. I am so glad I did! First of all, their daily (yes, daily!) happy hour is from 11-6. They were very busy, which I took as a good sign. There isn't a lot of seating inside, and it was super hot outside, so not many were willing to take a seat on their patio. However, they do have a fan system that seemed to keep it cool enough, and the patio is small but cute. I was able to grab a seat at the bar. I had the falafel gyro, and on my next visits tried the chilled pad thai salad and guacamole tostada. I wanted to try the Korean fried rice, but had the falafel again. Even though they were busy every time I went, they were always friendly and attentive not only to guests but to each other. Overall, good vibes here! I cannot visit Phoenix again without going here.

dOP1mamawzz13dfQtQP6RQ.text: Had the RoRo burger with fries and ordered the Avocado Crema on the side. The burger was good because they give you a generous amount of meat, I couldn't even finish mine and had to take it to go.  The fries were good as well, their seasoning is unique and tasty. The Avocado Crema was okay, it tasted like something around mayo, yogurt, or sour cream with a hint of avocado. Wish the avocado flavor was much stronger.  Also, service was excellent, probably the best part of the experience. Although it was very busy the waitress made sure to greet me, seat me, check on me, apologized for any wait, and always had a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The RoRo burger and fries with Avocado Crema.

YqtB1fDmSlOrlXV_QRLePg.text: I write this review with some reservation.  My reservation is because the young woman who waited on me (at the bar) for a late night dinner was terrific. She was cordial, helpful and generally wonderful, Best service in a long time. She, when asked, also recommended two dishes that I had seen other Yelpers make very positive comments about. I went with her recommendations.  Gyoza - Pot Stickers  Nice taste and texture, although could not discern the ingredients, but they were served cold inside and I saw them coming off of the grill, so I know they just weren't cooked long enough. Really unforgivable to be cold inside.   Fried Rice  The fried egg on top made it unique and different than most. The texture of the rice was not to my liking (too moist) and it had almost no taste at all, except for a bit of "heat," apparently from an imported pepper, according to my server. All in all VERY disappointing. Kind of reminded me of an old joke: "not very good food, but there was a lot of it."  So FIVE STARS for service, in a relatively pleasant environment, and NO STARS for food quality. Obviously I will not be returning for a second chance, as there are just too many other terrific options.

SKOTnda47thA0O7LKFge2A.text: Kevin waited on us and was so friendly. Great recommendations included the Korean fried rice and the Roro burger. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dDDUwHsOsAkVs6K9kBqinQ.text: The food here is so good! I had their fries with their sriracha sauce so bomb !!! Highly recommended! I know it sounds like a basic appetizer but they add their own spin to it ! Perfectly cooked and seasoned fries with their own in house sauce, great combination. Their shrimp tacos were so good here, all of the toppings were fresh ! We felt the tacos needed an extra kick, so we use some of their sriracha sauce on top. Thank me later ! We lucked up and visited during happy hour. All of their signature drinks were like 6 bucks ! And man were they good, different and strong ! Check out this gem  in downtown Phoenix! They also have a little art gallery that you can browse while you wait for your food, so cool! Outside seating with heaters, make for a very nice ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fries with the sauce
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp tacos
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Snoop and their peach drink

Q4YnLxLK2Zc63x83zbyesw.text: What a cool spot! After checking out the art museum, we relied on good old yelp to find us a place for lunch. The glowing reviews lead us here and we were so happy they did!  Upon entering the establishment from the heat of summer, it was refreshingly cool inside. Ahhhhhh. We were promptly seated at a table and asked if we had been there before. Our server was super nice and went over the menu with us. She also let us know about the fried chicken special that day... something about being soaked in Mexican coca-cola then breaded, topped with slaw and served on a bun with fries. I couldn't remember the rest of the specifics but it sounded amazing.   The menu isn't huge but has a nice variety of items. Cocktails sounded good and a few rather unique. We stuck with sprite (in a bottle of course) and their green iced tea. Waters were delivered as soon as we sat down too. Most tables were full but it didn't seem overwhelmingly packed for a Saturday around noon. Chill vibe.   I ended up ordering the fried chicken special, and my girlfriend got a plain cheeseburger. She enjoyed the burger and I was in heaven with my chicken.   It has just the right flavor.. a slight kick but nothing excessive, and the slaw was awesome. Their fries were also to die for.. whatever the seasoning is, I am obsessed. I'm so delicious and hardly needed ketchup or anything.   Our server remained super attentive, refilling drinks and checking in on us.   Overall cool vibe and great meal. I'd love to return when it's cooler to sit on the patio. Prices were reasonable as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced green tea
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plain burger
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken special

uwZsm5E69THUkfZlWN2AqA.text: Ridiculous!  It's the word that kept coming out of my mouth the night my son and I went for dinner.  We arrived before happy hour had wrapped up and were able to order a couple different 'ridiculous' drinks. (1/2 off during HH!)  We each had the 'sour' and the spiked chai.  So good.  I ordered the fish tacos and my son had the burger but we went half and half.  It was one of the most balanced, well-flavored burgers I've ever had.  Yes, it was ridiculous.  I was so happy.  The fries were spectacularly good.  There is no comparison in my humble opinion.  The sauces were equally good so try them all.  This is the perfect place to go when you're looking for elevated food in a super relaxed atmosphere.  Finish dinner and stroll down the street for some excellent, live jazz at The Nash.    What a great night in Phoenix!  This is the kind of place that makes venturing into a new city a really special experience.  So glad we visited and hope for the opportunity to try again.  Great job to the whole team!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W6pEsJfFDa-qeSr4ljFYBg.text: This place was delicious, affordable, and a very cool little restaurant. Happy hour daily from 11-6 so we had half off our drinks. Ceviche was excellent, as was their all day breakfast burrito!

EZ6pMSnsaTTaKi3evgLKLA.text: A True hidden gem! This review is solely based off the drinks because I have yet to order food from here. I've been here twice and each time the cocktails have been amazing! Strong yet fruity and full of flavor (the snoop & pear shaped). I love sitting outside on the patio. It's super cute and just a chill vibe overall! Only downside is it's in an alley so tons of flies. Found this place one day when I was looking for happy hour in the area. Safe to say I don't think any restaurant/bar beats The Dressing Room! HALF OFF DRINKS FOR HAPPY HOUR!? Count me in x100.

iPuxMs5OVOndPTFSMbYksw.text: I've been eyeing the RoRo burger from afar since I learned about The Dressing Room (maybe 6 months ago) because it's always looked so good. Unfortunately, looks are deceiving and I felt that the RoRo burger was pretty mediocre. The toppings on the burger don't seem to work well together despite sounding good on paper. I really couldn't taste the gruyere, the spicy Russian dressing, or the gastrique onion. The dominating flavor of the burger was the patty, which in this case was dry and under-seasoned. The bacon on top of the burger was my favorite part. English muffin buns were nice and soft with a slight chew.  Fries were cooked well, but the tajin seasoning was a bit too tart for me. I'd get these again if I came, but without the seasoning.  Service was prompt and food came out quickly. I'll probably be back to give their tacos a try next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. RoRo burger with fries
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Close up of the RoRo burger

lYdAC7eDjkuQO6iwZZnh6w.text: This place kinda speaks to ya soul, I really liked the set up..The Food was Amazing!!! for a nice weekend late night spot a Must gooo!!! Hold up the music was so soothing I feel all together like I had an Experience not just a night out....We willl be back again

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4jo_z4tHGS0Aq69nWJlIbA.text: A small intimate dining room with a bar that faces the open kitchen. Genius!  I trust people more they let me see them cook. Everyone at the bar was eating shrimp and chips. Not knowing if there was a requirement or just a popular item, I joined in. An excellent choice. I'll dine here again

Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

24c2ZAZpGD0GsU4I9jCFCQ.text: Stopped by for a drink and bite during happy hour prior to First Friday events. Quaint and intimate setting/seating with the huddle and bustle of servers floating throughout the dining area, bartender mixing up libations, and kitchen maestros mastering the harmony of flavors to be awaiting me on my plate.    The on-tap old fashioned was delightful and easy to sip while the Paloma could get a person in trouble by being too drinkable.    Pork belly fried rice and Gyoza made their way to our table and were quickly devoured with chopsticks in hand.   I'll definitely be back; several more drinks and bites I need to experience!

bAhjy97S9qeqZkL_lwYjig.text: The food is amazing. Courtney, Connor, and Sebastian were not only super helpful, but also very friendly and cheerful. The Chef (he doesn't like being called chef) is amazing and also lacking in ego, which makes the place feel a lot better for the employees and, in turn, the customers. Relaxed but amazing. Wish this restaurant was in my hometown.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly fried rice, roro burger, seasonal agua fresca, and chicha morada.

3LpzWakQ3MBl5839rndgDQ.text: AMAZING fish tacos - when I closed my eyes and took a bite, I could envision this being a taco offered from a vendor in Mexico... so flavorful and authentic. Also, the staff are very friendly and welcoming - this is a place you MUST checkout when in Phoenix, beyond glad that I did.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z-zqaFyU9C3UQbWgP_qIhQ.text: This place caught me off guard - I've known The Dressing Room existed but never really realized they had a full kitchen and served food; I've always assumed it was just a bar/cafe. After deciding to check out their menu, I realized they offer a lot of amazingly appetizing dishes that take seem to take a simple yet adventurous approach. The two dishes we ordered are precisely what we were in the mood for, however it was tough not to order other shareables off the menu like the Chorizo Poutine or the Spiced Falafel Gyro. We placed our order and got to fully enjoy the Open-Kitchen design as we sat at the bar top in front of the cook's workspace, gazing on as we watched each step of our food preparation. We watched as the egg was cooked to perfection, and as mysterious, battered items were added to the fryer. Not too long later, our plates appeared upon us and all of it came together in two artistic masterpieces. The pad Thai salad included the most incredibly delicious fried shiitake mushrooms we've ever had - almost a nutty but clean flavor to them. The crunchy texture of the fried mushrooms complimented the soft, chilled noodles in the plate. And as for the Pork Fried Rice, if you're a texture eater, this dish hits so many marks. We let the undercooked egg ooze out over our rice and meld into the array of flavors present. A few dabs of sriracha on top sets just the right amount of spice to this plate and you can bet we finished every last bite. Final thoughts about this restaurant: the soundtrack was perfect for the vibe of this place; the intimacy with the staff was just right - they were there when needed, interactive, but not invasive; and the actual ambiance and decor seemed to perfectly vibe with the overall vision of what this restaurant is meant to exude. I cannot wait to get back here again and try other menu items. Well done guys!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean Pork Belly Fried Rice
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilled Pad Thai Salad

DJhVCSc630-Bm1_wzZ8iPg.text: Great! Just great.   I had the burger and it was good and the fries were okay (they had some odd lemon seasoning that wasn't bad but I'd prefered just salt). I can't wait to go back and try the shrimp (I'll be updating).  They clearly have hired professionals and service was excellent.   Here's the real killer. The place. I ate on the patio under a sizable tree with a KICKASS speaker hanging in it. The sound was spectacular and the music exceptional (playing the likes of The Smiths, Washed Out and a slew of chillaxing hip hop that's probably hipper than I). For me, music makes everything better and they are nailing it this department. AND the patio is situated in the back, it's ALMOST hidden making it feel like a little sanctuary. It's typically something you see in New Orleans or in the cool little indie neighborhoods in other towns. This is RoRo's first and boy is it welcome.  Big ups!

jo4DxNd6WNyTdKDdbncBXA.text: Moving from Los Angeles to Phoenix as a young professional, I wasn't expecting to find a food spot in downtown that is right up there with any of the LA-based pubs/dinner spots. Living in the area, I have tried all the spots but Dressing Room keeps me coming back. I eat here all the time and it is always bomb. The churro ice cream sandwich is LIFE and so are the drinks as well as the fries. Not only all of that but they basically have all day happy hour. Guys- this is the perfect date spot.

IXoayvRPM9JQV6qNuM5aKg.text: This place has the best drinks!!  They also have happy hour on the weekends which is a great touch.  I had The Snoop cocktail and it was delicious.  My friend ordered the churro ice cream sandwich and it looked to die for!  Great service and nice patio area.

5cPlnCqS0KhpXK5pOgbOZQ.text: First time here, I saw the good reviews on Yelp and we decided to try it out. Loved the establishment, rustic, with modern, and a touch of art...... Good customer service, attentive, and friendly. Fries and burgers are good, the special sauce, with a tat of spicyness, very good.  If you're in the area, we recommended.

3NynTswn0wVUZcROtPwDwQ.text: I recently met some friends here for dinner. I was surprised at how small this place is, but we were able to seat a party of 6. I wouldn't take a larger party than that here though. The atmosphere is dark and kind of quirky. The music was somewhat loud in my opinion. However, the service was great and so was the food. The menu is very small, not a lot of choices in terms of what to eat. I got the Roro burger and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. It was delicious. Also the fries were phenomenal! They put a seasoning on the fries that is very tasty. My husband got the fish tacos and enjoyed them. We also tried the pickles and they were very good. I think overall everyone was happy with their food.

denVY8wN5A8X_KaXxZUdPw.text: My husband and I stopped here after a D-backs game, and we will definitely be back! The relaxed vibe was perfect for a Sunday dinner. We both had a cocktail (The Snoop), the All Day Burrito for him and the Peruvian Ceviche Salad for me. We finished with the churro ice cream sandwich. Save room for this! It was perfectly portioned for sharing, but not too filling. Great service too! We were there during a shift change, and had amazing service from everyone. We will absolutely come back next time we are in Phoenix!

znNcKD1QxCIwflf2knpHYw.text: Stopped by when there was a long wait at a lot of nearby restaurants and we were really impressed. The cocktail selection was fun. My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed what we ordered, both for food and drinks. The inside is quite small and we were seated on backless stools which wasn't the most comfortable, but for a quick meal it was just fine.

Ads5qrXUiP7fbWqDRiWMAg.text: Yessenia was very helpful and was great! Will definitely come back to get the churro and another peppered flower!

VH8Q-tZ4yBk0-u4D1wS9Xw.text: The best french fries I've ever had in my life! Excellent drinks and a great, personable staff. Love this place!

MZp8fyTjGEZF-1VXrKkqwg.text: Atmosphere is absolutely amazing. I love the outside seating and the eclectic music that plays. The fries were great! I ordered they All Day Burrito. Was not a huge fan of the cheese that was used on it. Kinda seemed like a velveeta cheese. I think a shredded cheese would be better. It was also a bit salty for my taste buds. My girlfriend ordered the fish tacos and she said they were amazing. Reminded her of a fresh fish taco from San Diego .

hJ2WXiqFfItyn6XHkmwG1Q.text: First place we ate on our vacation. Absolutely fantastic staff and food. We had the chorizo poutine on special and it was the best appetizer I've ever eaten. I had the RoRo burger, which was a super yummy take on a southwest burger, perfectly cooked and VERY juicy. We will definitely be back here in the future!

ngcWZVR-YW0HS6B6PjbmEg.text: We were really excited to try the Dressing Room. The menu is very limited so check it out before you go there. I had the RoRo Burger which was good but also very greasy and well done. French fries that come with it are good but typical fries, nothing to write home about. The space is really unique it is connected to other shops. We sat inside but the back patio looked very cute.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. RoRo Burger and fries

Kr9d4qMJ48oV0evTL4GAqg.text: Stopped by The Dressing Room for a quick coffee and to get caught up on a few emails. The space is artsy, relaxing, and cool. The staff are friendly and offer great recommendations on their rotating coffee selection and menu. I even had a chance to chat with the business manager Brian, who's headed to Germany for Octoberfest. Highly recommend stopping in for a visit next time you're downtown! FYI: There is free parking for customers in the lot off of 2nd street, behind the cafe.

oBiUYXOUoetr50Uss4fBbg.text: The food was great! The service was even better! We loved the atmosphere too. My husband thought the burger was delicious and unique...I really liked the fish tacos.

6ozkPjlQ2rbBcyeCMhTi6A.text: This place is absolutely amazing! We came around 5:20 on a Friday night and lucked out with a spot on the patio. We enjoyed some delicious half price cocktails (this places happy hour rocks) and got the shrimp and chips which were AMAZING! We ended with the churro ice cream sandwich which again was AMAZING! I will most definitely be back to this small and hip restaurant. Thank you for the excellent service, food, and experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UTlnU7tC2hu1x9hK40sTwg.text: Its a little confusing at first when you walk in; there's an art gallery, bistro, and hip-breakfast joint all in one space. Don't be thrown off because, just know the food is good! Try their "Spicy White Chick" a blend of pleasantly sweet spicy iced coffee, mmuah, perfection.

T4LeHwYk9aKX_mCLYYNzZQ.text: I was just here tonight with 8 other friends, all in the USAF. It was some of the best food all of us ever had. Amazing service. Unbelievable atmosphere. The servers were incredible and so friendly and accommodating even though we showed up around 10:30 and they close at 11pm. This is by far one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. Absolutely incredible experience. Thank you so much to the servers and cooks that work here for taking wonderful care of us.

PULvlqo8u0eVizlmTia68g.text: Whooow... great chill spot to hit in central Phoenix. Patio was awesome and the food fantastic.  We had a couple great cocktails, rosemary and sage Bourbon, and then a Moscow mule version they call The Donkey!  Both excellent.  I had read that the fries were a must, and they delivered.  Crunchy with a slight malt vinegar flavor. Not overwhelming, very good.  I had the Ro Ro Burger on one heck of an awesome English muffin. We also had the fish tacos, excellent... and beer battered shrimp with fries.  Shrimp was great but not something I'd go back for with so much other good stuff on the menu to try.   We also had stellar service from Michelle and were pleasantly surprised when Brian the Director of Concepts for the Dressing Room stopped by to say hi.  Only took a minute to figure out these guys are the real deal, succeeding at delivering a great experience with quality food! Well done Brian and team.   Note: Also found out they own the little coffee shop attached to the Dressing Room with some killer B'fast items. Not full service B'fast but enough selection to enjoy a variety of things.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QDVIY25WDiffYQafYqpcxA.text: Great RoRo burger and TJ taco. Good local beer. The Snoop smelled great but wasn't worth the tag. Slow service!

7XBx0S4oepWbMguS4uoHQQ.text: This has been a regular stop for us since moving downtown! I'm addicted to the TJ Tacos. Staff is always friendly and attentive! Looking forward to some cooler weather to enjoy some street side dining!

HCek3_1joVIaMVBu481Nmw.text: Cool little joint, great music and fab food. My boyfriend had the burger, liked it a lot (and he's picky). I had the breakfast burrito and it hit the spot. Best part was the churro ice cream sandwich, do yourself a favor and get this first!! Yum!!!

sMvnC__nQWwmrR24hC7zuQ.text: Amazing! Ordered a house margarita, the shrimp and chips and finally the churro ice cream sandwich. Everything was delicious!

W75o8D1rKP871TH92_YO2A.text: Everything was perfect. The RoRo Burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had. The service was awesome. I can't wait to go back.

Fgy0-sXL51khFW0Sb_i9sQ.text: Nice, trendy little place. We enjoyed sitting outside on the patio eating our lunch. The staff is very friendly and also good at explaining the name and history of the restaurant. My husband and I both had hamburgers which were delicious and the fries were so good with a special seasoning. Will be checking out their happy hour since the cocktails looked so yummy!

KLRLNuYzjGClbcLVLRvs4g.text: I have to say that the dressing room was a pleasant place to be to meet up with friends and a kickback. The atmosphere and artwork was bananas in a good way, the food was delightful and the drinks were off the chain. I enjoyed every bit and moment that I had at this place.

4aARaM3Afr_qudB0FBKQVA.text: Phenomenal service.  And I mean that.  I walked in and I had three people immediately welcome me. I sat at the bar and had great conversation with one of the chefs and with cool peeps at the bar. Drinks and food came fast!  The food was great- I had the Yakatori.  Delicious! Eat them like Asian lettuce wraps...Only if you can because they're huge. All in all a great addition to the neighborhood.  Check it out!

U7D2Lxl1jJz0mnOa5iGXtg.text: Been there 4 times already!! Food is good everyone is friendly. The Churro Ice Cream Sandwich is to die for.

siSVC1Bm7zM-1Q9RHq41MA.text: Amazing atmosphere and great vibe coupled with friendly and educated staff. The food was urban and tasty. Reasonably priced. Will definitely be back.

l2BkE5cP1Yhhtx_I0Cwxxg.text: Amazing. We got the Korean skewers (pro-tip: add an extra skewer for only $3) and fries with avo crema. Then the drinks: the happy hour is amazing. Half off everything?!? We got: the rosemary and sage, the peppered elderflower, and the Paloma, plus a beer and a new bourbon. Great price, wonderful service, quaint dog friendly patio. We'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The rosemary and sage and the Paloma

51mFfX48nhk9rrdmtcrtJQ.text: We stopped in for dinner on a Saturday night and were happy to be able to be seated right away.  My husband enjoyed his cocktail and I enjoyed my non-alcoholic house made beverage.  We tried the fries, which are quite tasty.  My husband ordered a burger (which he said tasted very good) and I had the veggie tacos.  While my tacos weren't spicy (that's my husband's preference), I enjoyed the creativity and the flavor.  I would definitely come here again for those.  There was a little mix up with our order, but it was recognized immediately and the staff went out of their way to remedy things.  We were quite happy with our experience here.  It would be great if they had more convenient parking, however.

KKVAyHnUYsUKNU_OC-MocQ.text: My meal was delicious, the service was great and the general vibe of the place was awesome! The cocktail I also had was great! Would happily go again, perfect for a catch up with friends or even a date because of the close proximity and genre of the place! Loved it.

1pX8ackF1xlvH5fSDDzviQ.text: My new favorite restaurant. I loved it. The food was food. The weather was good. The lighting was good. Everything. The only thing I didn't really enjoy is that a loud party of 6 were seated next to us. The tables are so close together...I felt like they were in my conversation and I was in theirs. Other than that....this place is great!

1BMUD_QK70aahCjd9KCH5g.text: Lovely micro restaurant! The kitchen staff is welcoming and the wait staff is very kind. My favorite drink is the seasonal aqua frescas and the churro ice-cream sandwich is my favorite dessert in all of phoenix

aevCi5qh1LzlV-XasHADdA.text: All I can say is "Wow!" My fiance and I came here for an early dinner/happy hour during our short trip to Phoenix. We sat on the patio, which had a nice ambiance. Drinks were amazing (half price before 6:00). For food we shared an order of fries with a spicy Russian sauce and an order of the veggie tacos. I tend to be somewhat of a French fry snob, and these truly did NOT disappoint. The tacos had great flavor, and were filling enough, but not so much that we couldn't save room for dessert -- the churro ice cream sandwich! An ice cream sandwich made with churros and vanilla bean gelato! So delicious! Definitely a must-stop if you're in the Phoenix area.

heTmlv3hAIFSdugMY_7M4Q.text: You guys did it again. Great vibe, drinks and food. The staff is so down to earth and friendly. We have loved your coffee shop since dAy one and will now equally love this place.

B-nz5VsSCLKdiRpL9sx1qg.text: First time here. Arrived for happy hour. Great prices on the drinks. One of the best burgers I've ever had.

FXuO4taIsTe36m9pmavoEQ.text: Great food with a really awesome atmosphere! Centrally located to the art district in Phoenix. Love the coffee shop and art museum tied to it as well.

oAeI02CpDlbqc8MIR9WZfw.text: Drinks awesome. Burger so damn good. Veggie tacos were on point. Dog friendly patio. Half price drinks on a Sunday afternoon. Service was impeccable. Ambience was super chill with good tunes. What else can you ask for?

-PSeJ1Wc9eQ72kp8TQPzyQ.text: All day burrito and the fish tacos were phenomenal. Hand made cocktails were great as well. For a smaller menu, they do everything well

8qUc5_xJTKl9v3hwXT0pCg.text: I've driven by this place a couple of times on the way to work and have always wanted to check it out, well today I did and it was completely worth it! I stooped for lunch and had the Classic Burger (American Cheese, Tomato, Red Onion, Butter Lettuce, Mayo) served on a toasted English Muffin, It was perfect. As I set at the bar waiting for my order I could see them making some of their other dishes and the Breakfast Burrito looked Amazing, I think I'll try that next time. Phoenix is known for its good local food and this place is no exception, I highly recommend The Dressing Room!

LaqvAZ_zff9_QPW05QdxJg.text: Delicious food! I had the Roro burger with House chips and it was the perfect blend of flavors!! The staff was also very inviting and able to explain everything so well. The best meal I had during my trip!

3fQfnJLyrFMIvxuM4HmZqw.text: We had an unplanned stopover in Phoenix and stumbled across this absolute gem. Great food (RoRo burger and fish tacos) and friendly, relaxed but quick service. The seasonal draft (cherry) was delicious and the effort was made to explain the finer details. The servers were all great with suggestions and we had a look around the art gallery next door. Certainly a night and meal to remember.

Z59PoVMtSL17fH9wd4I8YQ.text: Super friendly staff, delicious food and affordable prices! This place is a winner! The RoRo burger was fabulous and the fries were on point. Also, definitely be sure to splurge on the churro ice cream sandwich. So excited to finally have them in the neighborhood. You'll be seeing a lot of us, Dressing Room!

IWWwBAuS_rNv3PIV8_YI7A.text: The BF and I were looking for an alternative to the quirky but highly-crowded Welcome Diner. Decided to give this little place a try based on the Yelp reviews and the short but interesting-looking and reasonably-priced menu, and we were not steered wrong.  Went in about an hour before closing on a Sunday evening and decided to sit out in the patio to take advantage of the balmy 80o weather.  The server was attentive and helpful.  The BF had the shrimp & chips - the batter was light and crispy, the aioli was tangy, and the chips were well-done, just as the BF likes them.  I had the Cold Soba Salad; lots of interesting flavors which went well together, very refreshing.  I also allowed myself to be talked into adding a skewer of the Korean Yakitori - the meat was rich, tender, and flavorful.  The BF also enjoyed his Pineapple Ginger Beer Agua Fresca.  WE SHALL RETURN!!!

yLlkVVt7PgLFI4juUvBqCA.text: Stumbled upon this place on yelp while in the area since I was STARVING. It did not disappoint! I had the all day burrito and my mom had the RoRo burger which was made on an English muffin. We split them so we could try each. Both were amazing and I would order again. We had some French fries so I asked for dipping sauce and they had three house made sauces they make there. This is what really sold me on the place. They got great sauce. My personal fav for French fries was the malted aioli, but there was an avocado creme was also amazing on the burrito! The third sauce was a Russian something or other and it was also a tasty option. The guys who run the place are all super cool, I'm glad they decided to open this place. The atmosphere is super modern and big city feel. Very into it, will return!

WJYkEYDRCFEcUJyuQG9MQA.text: friendliest staff on the planet. Cocktails were killer. Not to mention Happy Hour every day :-) The place is a bit small, but they have a well designed outside back patio that makes up for it. They have a small menu but everything we've had so far, from the fries to the Ro Burger, are phenomenal. Best little restaurant ever. Will definitely be heading out there often.

kr8LsUkTqF3FqxVdIpPvNg.text: Welcoming customer service, delicious food and drinks. I will definitely be coming back.

biQCQvgK7UXx3FPo3X5O8Q.text: Great cocktails. Ceviche sales very fresh and enjoyable. Burrito was packed with delicious ingredients.

a67vLK1XdoPGw-XLYs_MVw.text: The absolute friendliest service from every employee we encountered. We were seated outside on the patio which had such a cool, relaxing vibe. The menu was simple, but just enough and everything looked amazing, it was hard to choose! Loved everything about our experience here, 10/10 recommend!

5DjOrKcIEZl0S7OGeOz_VA.text: So much more than just burgers.  Awesome street food type menu paired with unique and exciting cocktails.  Staff is incredibly attentive and friendly.  Get there!

wsnEuANWogFIs3Wcs0qfVw.text: Wow is all I can say about this place definately go here the food the ambience and the art will blow your mind but the vibe will make you feel at home. Menu is short sweet and delicious!!!!

C_ExzCvReu2bUAg6yRfBIg.text: Great new place. The atmosphere was very nice and clean. The waiter was very funny and helpful. He recommended almost everything we ordered and we were not disappointed. The fish tacos were amazing! Nice little hang out spot for some cocktails after work. Will definitely be back.

dvwR4m1c_mfzkMhc18T2YA.text: Great new restaurant on Roosevelt Row!!! We have returned several times since our first visit because the food (RoRo Burger), drinks (Rosemary & The Sage), atmosphere, and music is all top notch! On our 3 visits the staff is always friendly and welcoming.  Troy, the owner is always around the patio visiting with customers and it always feels like you are visiting your friends.  AND ORDER THE CHURRO ICE CREAM DESSERT, ITS AMAZING!!

fMceOi2vif9nsnRNcu5IPw.text: Well thought out menu with excellent execution. The staff was great and very attentive and the atmosphere is very cool.

cojsLbfZrZlFaqKDAtV-rQ.text: What a great find ... food was delicious (check out the RoRo Burger) and service was lightning fast ... we sat at the bar, so that probably helped.  Service staff was very friendly and helpful, and drinks were excellent.    We were there in June, however, which is dead in Phoenix, but it was still crowded (which is why we ended up at the bar), so my only concern would be that it must get crazy-jammed when the weather cools down and ASU is back in session ... you will want to call ahead to check wait time ... otherwise, this place is a "10"

y3xysZDDV9SvnuwycGlUpw.text: All Day Burrito is deliciously amazing. Love it, Love it, Love it! I will definitely be coming back for it! Not to mention great vibes - everyone smiling and having a great time, and the intoxicating aroma of the food and coffee (from be, next door)!

djBmGL1q7_31yms60wvegQ.text: Got lunch here and got the all day burrito. First thing I noticed was great portions for the price! The burrito was great. I picked off a few fries from my friends' plates too and they were fantastic too. Unfortunately, after eating half the burrito, I noticed my lips becoming slightly swollen (I have a peanut allergy), and I immediately notified the waitress. Shortly after, the chef (I assume, perhaps the manager) came out and apologized. He was so kind and accommodating. He offered to get me something else so I ordered the TJ Tacos which were also very good. Perfect portion size and fresh. At the end of it all they took care of the entire meal, which was very, VERY kind of them. I appreciated their accommodations and sincerity in apologizing, although I do not put any blame on them for the minor allergic reaction I had. Definitely recommend this spot. Good atmosphere is a plus too. Very kind staff made the experience a positive one for me, despite me having a slight reaction.

nX4gLV1QPC1Mh0TFuSSf4A.text: Aside from the amazing atmosphere, the food and drinks are unique and anything but status quo! The owner has done an amazing job with making a great think out of such a small space. The food is delicious with great portions. The drinks are delicious and they're on happy hour everyday until 6pm! Probably one of the best happy hour spots in the area. Love, love, love and will continue to come back!!

05-uSFxZ7MucfoqpK6ehyQ.text: This place is rapidly coming one of my go to's Downtown.  The space is attached to Be Coffee and the monOrchid and it is quite obvious this is a vision that they have been working on for some time. Troy and the rest of the gang at Conceptually Social really hit the nail on the head with their ambiance, lighting, energetic and enthusiastic staff, and killer patio.  Awesome touch with a shipping container on the North end of the patio for storage and such was a great touch.  The food standouts to me thus far would be the TJ fish tacos and the RORO Burger.  Happy hour happens daily and does not end until 6!  If you like old school hip hop, one of the best patios Phoenix has to offer, tasty food, craft cocktails, and great service, go check out The Dressing Room!

y5jhjz-sCERM72ybsgCMpQ.text: A unique and easy going place. Very nice and energetic staff, and light decor. The menu is small ( not a bad thing..), i enjoy a place that perfects the food they make rather than a menu of 30 things and its all.. just ok. With that being said..had the burger and fries. Burger was fantastic and light and has a unique twist to the bread which i loved.. It was really good. Friend had a salad which she loved ( hey Jill) ..  Giving it four stars simply because id love just a few more options. If they can add another salad option, a light fish dish with a unique side.. and maybe a healthy trio appetizer for those who want to sit and chat over drinks... Ijs ! ..ill be back :)

kmpYBHuPRPOgOP2Ma8mBSg.text: First off, the atmosphere here is why i love it. It's in the middle of the city on a busy street but they do manage to keep it low key. Music is a bit loud making it difficult to talk with a friend or date. However, the playlist is good.  The food is pretty good and tasty. There isn't much on the menu but i believe it does fit the place. Simplicity. I've had a couple drinks and i believe the choice could be a bit more diverse but i can't say that for sure until i come back. Also, a date of mine ordered a Bloody Mary but they did not have what was needed at the time which stuck me as odd.   All in all, i do really enjoy the dressing room and plan on coming back in the  near future.

_q0Y59Zo7D20LcxuH13uyg.text: Found the Dressing Room here on yelp awhile back and ventured right in. The seating inside consists of a counter overlooking the prep/cook area and just a few tables. A gentleman (who I quickly figured was a manager) was seated at one of the tables - he looked up from his laptop, acknowledged me and offered me the table. Nice!   I was hungry for breakfast (at my usual 2pm) and was delighted to see an "all-day burrito" on the menu. My server was prompt, friendly and got my order in quickly after I was seated. However, while waiting...and waiting... it seemed "a bit long for a burrito," I chuckled to myself, "is it that it takes all day to get it, hence the name?!" My chuckle was silenced though, when that burrito showed up and it was the mostly perfectly wrapped thing I've ever seen. Like a mid-day tenderbelly-bacon gift! Not only that, it tasted delicious - the other ingredients in it: scrambled eggs, American cheese, crispy hashbrowns, avocado, roasted corn, and pico de gallo. The fries were some of the best I've ever had as well. (Score points on that whipped avocado sour cream that is one of the choices of dip with the fries; you may also choose from malt aioli or spicy Russian.) The same manager who gave me the table popped back over to ask about my food and he commented out of the blue, "yeah, we call it the 'all day burrito' since you can get it any time of day." Is he a mind-reader too!? Haha, it's as if he known that I secretly had doubted. Well, I would wait all-day for this thing anyway, so I guess it works out either way. The rest of the menu deserves further exploration at a time TBD!  I also like that The Dressing Room has a large outdoor seating area and that it shares space with the adjacent coffee shop.   Really nice visit I had - love the urban decor, open kitchen and the excellent food and service...I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fries w/avo crema (whipped avocado sour cream)
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All day burrito

ZMVb23_VQNTV_RsT5BMWiQ.text: What a find!  After spending some time downtown, the family decided to Yelp It! for lunch and we stumbled on The Dressing Room. We're so lucky we did!  The menu has just enough option for most tastes, and honestly everything looked good to me.  We had the Korean Yakatori Skewers, All Day Burrito, Fish Tacos, and the Soba Salad.  All 4 meals were fantastic. We can wait to get back!

NQixxj0CEajRLe1rP6k8aA.text: This was a nice surprise! Great food, love the look and feel of the place. Very cozy. I had the Burger (not the classic), can't remember the name of it, but it was delicious with extra bacon (see my pics)! The fries were great and crispy all the sauces were really good. You'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Q1kF6wW_73pCF8Da8tQOUg.text: First time here for dinner on a Wednesday night. Very cool decor. Friendly staff greeted us at the door.  Explained the menu and the concept of the restaurant. We order the Ro Ro Burger, Shrimp and chips and yakatori. The open kitchen is very cool. Dinner was fantastic? We went back a 2nd time.  The menu did not interest us so. Nice place and nice people.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NWhn6Jjx9sYUG3YBN9uW-A.text: Come for the burger. Stay for the churro ice cream sandwich!! From the atmosphere to the service, this place is phenomenal!

QnjkT-SvgxBbjx48nGgF0g.text: Cutest little place! Definitely a gem in Phoenix. The food is great! I've had the all day burrito and fish tacos. The staff is also very nice!

7HY4MZQe7qDCEDBMX3kBPA.text: The Burger we got was really good, the meat was on point the sauce made even better. The fries were bomb too and the drinks were sooo good!!! Would recommend and totally go back!! Also sit outside in the front patio the view of phoenix sunset is just amazing!

hv5l1iCkUmhfIoxla7dklQ.text: Alright so this place is pretty small so expect a wait most times.  They have Happy Hour EVERY DAY from 11 AM - 6 PM with half off of beer, wine and cocktails (they do 9oz wine pours). The patio is gorgeous and they have a bunch of speakers hanging from the large tree in the center. They are always bumping good music.   My only complaint is the patio backs the alley and the dumpster so you get some pretty nasty smells wafting over. The smell is worth it for the RoRo burger, it seriously kicks delicious ass. It's on an english muffin with a thick slice of bacon... Yum. The servers are all super nice and friendly here as well.

qWFoRf-XIkHJxtMweQluiA.text: I work downtown and saw this new spot had great reviews so I decided to try this out. I came with a coworker and we were immediately greeted when we walked in and chose to sit inside. I didn't want to melt outside even though the weather was nice. Everyone was very friendly and we never felt ignored.   I had the all day burrito and a coworker had the soba salad. Both were delicious and my mouth watered as I saw other food coming from the kitchen. I am definitely excited to go back and try some of the other items on the menu. They serve Mexican coke and coke light here as well which made my meal even better.  I did also hear there was a good happy hour here, so definitely will check that out soon.   I was bummed I was too full to try the churro ice cream sandwich, but for sure next time. Great food, pretty fast, I definitely will be back.

0_vtu5T4MuZWL5UaaIg7XA.text: I wish I could rate Food & Service separately because the FOOD was absolutely AMAZING and deserves 5 STARS!! I got the RoRo Burger...hands down the best burger I've ever had. Fries were a little over seasoned but still pretty dang good. But...  The service was terrible. Everyone working seemed pissed cause the small quarters and they were way over staffed. The servers were grumpy, all of them. Snappy to each other about taking things out to tables and where orders have went.   The charming thing about this restaurant is the small quarters, so the servers need to remember that it is SMALL and to leave their attitudes at the door. The servers have a chance to really create an awesome experience and unfortunately, they really ruined mine. But that burger will definitely have me coming back for more!

6X1OgUVSKkSrCy4hCa32GQ.text: Just another great local business to add to your list! Few tables inside next to the quaint kitchen. Head out to the back and enjoy the patio area. Great size for a group of friends after work or with your significant other.   Simplicity is key sometimes, and that is what the menu offers. A handful of options to satisfy different taste buds. Would you like shrimp and chips? Or maybe a all day breakfast burrito? Or simply go with a burger and fries in which they season the fries with Tajin! Brilliant idea!   We both enjoyed our choices and so will you. Give them a try and support the businesses in our wonderful Downtown Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qKD7K58MKA1MJl5yjyddRg.text: The Dressing Room is a place to stop if you are downtown.  1st there is 1/2 happy hour 11-6 everyday!  They have great hand crafted drinks! The eats menu is not huge, but I have always said I would rather a restaurant do a few things great than lots of things mediocre.  I debated about a few things but picked the RoRo burger.  It and the fries were awesome!  It came on an English muffin which was perfect!  It was dense enough to keep the burger together and added to the flavor make up of the burger. They have a daily special everyday, today was Korean fried rice with shrimp, that my friend got and it she said it also was really good!  There is not a ton of indoor seating but there is also patio seating which would be great in the winter time. Ahhhhh almost forgot...the staff was great and really prompt.  We were a little early for lunch and they came and got us from the coffee area when they were ready to serve lunch.  The food and drinks were both served prompt and he staff was super pleasant. I would totally make a point to eat here again!

7k2czYC58BSEe-bBq6etAA.text: AMAZING FOOD & COCKTAILS. We got into Phoenix late at 9 pm and I took to yelp to find a good restaurant close to our airb&b - The Dressing Room was at the top of the yelp list and it exceeded every expectation!! The entire staff was so friendly and attentive to us. The cocktails were perfect and the food was beyond delicious. I had the veggie tacos - best veggie tacos I've ever had in my life!!! If I lived in Phoenix I would be coming here weekly!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fOQpTZF36iTzFrGzqEOk8w.text: Five stars well-deserved here.  Totally great experience - food, service, drinks, everything.  A local recommended this place to us - so, we went in with our party of four on a busy Sunday evening.  So, it's a little smallish in there - but the very friendly host engaged with us right away, and set up a table - we didn't have to wait more than about 2 minutes.  They were quick with the cocktails / beers, and our server was really friendly and professional.  She carded my two younger guests, which I liked!  I had the Korean pork belly bowl - it was spicy, delicious, and plentiful.  It's also a cool space, adjacent to some kind of local art gallery.  I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

HVN2fzPuRKaUNOvPWBrtDg.text: For those of you who've been to such valley staples as Welcome Diner, 32 Shea, or one of the numerous valley Dutch Bros Coffee stops, you know firsthand how great things can emanate from small spaces.  The kitchen might be small, the menu might be limited, but even small but mighty spaces like these can leave you with a great impression.  I invite you to add another space to that list.  Opened just a day before my first appearance here, the guys at Conceptually Social have added a second Roosevelt Row restaurant to their repertoire in the form of The Dressing Room.  A small but mighty restaurant concept bringing what they're calling "elevated global street food" to the masses.  Located right next door to Conceptually Social's first restaurant incarnation Be Coffee (a wildly popular Roosevelt Row hub inside the equally popular MonOrchid), The Dressing Room is a tiny interior space with seating for maybe 16 inside.  The kitchen up front doubles as the bar and today was manned by an impressively bearded California transplant named Parker and his staff.  There is also a patio out back with shaded seating for close to 30 (something I'm sure will get usage as the weather warms back up).  The building also opens up to the Be Coffee space for overflow interior seating if needed.  The menu, despite being less than extensive really does cover a wide culinary geography.  You'll find American, Mexican, Peruvian, Korean, and even Japanese items on the docket.  The drink menu has more of an American tilt, but nevertheless incorporates a number of international flavors where possible.  For my drink, I went with the Cold Weather going with the theme of this unusually cold day in the Phoenix area.  This one has a slightly Italian flare with some Aperol mixed in with Bourbon, Ginger Beer and a couple of fruit flavors.  For my first entree, I'm on Roosevelt Row so it must be the RoRo Burger.  Gruyere Cheese, Russian Dressing, Bacon, and caramelized onions with an english muffin substituting for a bun.  And the fries, interestingly, were doused not with salt but with tajin mexican seasoning.  Really excellent burger (particularly the Russian dressing) and I liked the different spin on the fries.  For dessert, there is currently just one menu item to choose from as I write this, but it will undoubtedly get the attention of anyone who reads it the first time around.  The Churro Ice Cream Sandy is a vanilla ice cream sandwich with little round churro disks on the top and bottom (and these literally have the taste and texture of True churros).  This thing was delicious, but a mess.  I would probably recommend cutting the sandwich with a knife and spooning up the goodness from there.  Or if you don't care about the mess, grab it with two hands and go nuts.  I doubt they'll judge.  Total cost for the drink, burger, dessert, tax and tip came to about $26.  Much like their sister restaurant Be Coffee, The Dressing Room's menu is reasonably priced and approachable.  The staff is laid back and the artwork on the walls is quintessentially Roosevelt Row.  The location is primed for the First Friday crowds that will undoubtedly flood in before long.  And their late night hours will be a big boost to the late night crowds that frequent this neighborhood.  So cheers to the folks at Conceptually Social.  Two restaurants, two big hits.  What small wonder will they come up with next?

1akv-0FgHBWTaecadvq2pA.text: Best happy hour for drinks!   All cocktails, beers, and wines are 50% off everyday from 11AM-6PM.   Cocktails were fantastic. My favorite was the Pear Shaped ($10; HH $5) - vodka, spiced pear, rosemary & sage honey, and orange bitters. It was refreshing and delicious.  Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to chill & drink.

We sat out at the patio, it was getting hot but our server was always around filling our cups with icy water. We shared the Roro burger and the Bulgogi Gyoza. We loved everything!! The staff is thoroughly invested in The Dressing Room as they are welcoming, cheerful, well versed  in the menu.  Our gem of a waitress, Katie, was happy to give us recommendations and she did not disappoint.   The happy hour cocktails, wine and beer were half price and very creative. 0Wd34OjeHtPKPnPH9K6JYA.text: DAMN fine food.   Off the chart service and hospitality.  Menu is varied and simple and the value is outstanding.    We had the Korean lettuce cups that were phenomenal.  The All-Day burrito was delicious and it was finished Dorado Style on the flat top.  The Korean Fried Rice was BOMB...so delicious.  We split a Churro Ice Cream Sammy that was wonderful and we loved the slight chew to the cinnamon encrusted churro.    Keke the Chef is a stellar artist and her food is off the chart.

Qpz7IutzKUkTLWVWV3tWFw.text: Have you ever wondered what it might be like to go to a coffee shop, eat at a restaurant and visit an art gallery, all at the same time?!  Well wonder no more with the Dressing Room!   Joined to the well reviewed Coffee + Food + Stuff that we had originally planned to visit for some brunch, The Dressing Room is open and light with a variety of breakfast and brunch items to choose from, as well as cocktails and other drink options for the lady (or pretty much anyone) who likes to leisure!  It's got a very cute outside patio, which was perfect for the mid-November day and the fact that we brought our pooch with us too.  Comfy seating, clean facilities and speakers dangling overhead from a tree that shades guests from the sun, The Dressing Room is an ideal spot to while away an hour or two and diminish the hunger that bound to appear after exploring part of the city.  Service was friendly and prompt and the food was great! My partner went for the breakfast burrito, which was full of ingredients and filled him up completely!  I went for the fish ceviche.. YUM!! This dish was presented wonderfully, filled with lots of colours, textures and flavours! The fish was seasoned well, the large beans were a subtle balance to the citrus-tasting salad and the saltiness and crunch from the maiz tostado balanced the softness from the sweet potato. For me, the salad was slightly over-dressed and the citrus a little too sour, but it didn't ruin the rest of the flavours.  We could've stayed out there for hours, if it hadn't been for a good few flies that liked to take refuge under the same tree and sniff the same food that we had assumed for ourselves.  Despite having to waft a few flies, we left The Dressing Room with satisfied stomachs and loved walking off our lunch while cluing ourselves up on local art at the gallery attached.
