9dtfymwp-fLMBLPDNOiz2g.text: The Dressing Room, the Dressing Room ... this place had its highs and lows a roller coaster of an experience, enter into a kinda cramped space with friendly staffers, sit at a cute bistro table with a REAL LIVE CACTUS! Order your meal, I had a cappuccino and the breakfast burrito, for my lady the chicken Sammy - now for the juice of the review, the fries with the different dipping spread was whimsically delicious, an excellent starter course. The entrees honesty underwhelmed - since moving to the culinary melting pot that is the Phoenix metro area I have been on a quest for the most delicious breakfast burrito - the dressing room won't even make the top 10 list, it was dull and underwhelming, small by the standards of its peers. The chicken Sammy was a behemoth but again underwhelming as I have found most fried chicken sandwiches lack the necessary juice to propel them to the utmost top of my taste bud stratosphere.   We finished off with the churro and that is the saving grace of the dressing room, pictured it was a incredible flavor journey of immense proportions. Will come back to this cute establishment to try any number of their bevy of options!!

1nZGPZKLBKebVhcnsChYaw.text: Love this place! Excellent cocktails. Delicious food. I love the burger and the lettuce wraps. Everything I've tried has been awesome. It is a small space, but while waiting you can go look at the displayed art in the adjoining space. The patio is super cool when the weather is right.

iSwizCH_-K586-carRx3eA.text: After reading a few reviews we were a little confused but intrigued by what the menu had to offer. Options from pad thai to snitzel and fish tacos, spiking our interest in more ways then just our original taco Tuesday search. The space was pretty cool with an outdoor seating area in the front as well as an adorable back patio. Drink, the Paloma was bomb with a splash of cinnamon and vanilla. For food we got the bulgagi gyoza, the lettuce cups and the fish tacos. Eveything was pretty tasty with the gyoza topping the charts for me, such a different flavor then any gyoza I've ever had and being a big fan of Korean beef - it did not disappoint! A cool and eclectic spin on some classics, in a great area of downtown Phoenix, and I would definitely recommend.

uiM_q7F8ROS9CUpQCOk-2w.text: If you're ever in the Art district, lunch here is a MUST! This spot is perfect for friends, and even cooler for a date.   The RoRo Burger on a bun was everything one would want from a burger, juicy, fresh, high quality meat, and cooked right. With salad and fries hitting the same notes of freshness and flavor, I was in heaven.   The vibe is just as hip and colorful as Roosevelt Row without any sacrifices made to the friendly wait staff.   The cozy indoor seating fits just a few peeps but the larger outdoor area carries the same chic and comfortable aesthetic.   Tip: during the week drinks are half off during the day - here's me drinking tequila with grapefruit, cinnamon, and vanilla.

FrpwsBKZkJos_7R3Lk6RWg.text: I'm all about this place! The Dressing Room has been on my list of places to try in downtown Phoenix for a while now. I'm sad I haven't made time to try it out sooner. It was awesome!  The restaurant layout and design is unique. I enjoy the idea of restaurants sharing the same space with other food/entertainment venues. The Dressing Room is attached to a coffee shop and an art gallery. I look forward to checking out the coffee shop on my next visit as it was closed during the time of visit.   My wife and I ordered the RoRo burger (Gruyere Cheese, Gastrique Onion, Spicy Russian sauce, Butter Lettuce, Tenderbelly Bacon, on a Toasted English muffin) and the TJ tacos (Beer Battered White Fish, Cabbage, Pico De Gallo, Avocado Crema, on two Flour Tortillas). Both dishes were delicious and full of awesome flavors. I'd get either again!

iD1BZJxI0Pj-MltIoyScFA.text: Recently came into the dressing room. I was here for a conference originally from San Francisco. I'm a big foodie and I really cherish great service but also great food. I came and apprehensive, the restaurant only had nine patrons. But it was 119 outside, I was famished. I walk straight up the bartender he looked me straight in the eye. What can I get you sir, I replied: refreshing, anything refreshing. He said water and this-- he handed me a bourbon concoction- a bourbon drink with rosemary. Absolute perfection.  He directed me towards the menu-- I was lost. He graciously invited me to the fried rice, the TJ tacos, or RORO burger. I scarfed down my choice, the RoRo, hungry for more however his presence was satisfactory enough. I asked his name, Adam, he whispered through his beard. I am I incredibly grateful. I cannot wait to return soon.

AI-wpvaOy_GbRujSfvGs2w.text: Went to this cozy spot for dinner. The environment is quite interesting! It is directly connected to the MonOrchid Gallery and a little coffee shop which makes it kind of a unique and cool setup!  We opted to sit outside, they had an industrial fan and misters going, so even in the 90's it was quite nice!   We started with fries and avocado crema dipping sauce and spicy Russian dipping sauce! The fries were well seasoned by themselves and the sauces made them that much better!  I ordered the RoRo burger and hubs got the TJ fish tacos.   The burger was perfectly cooked, had the spicy Russian dressing and gruyere cheese...need I say more?! It was pretty tasty! It also came with fries so we were up to our elbows in delicious French fries!  The fish tacos came by 2's and were a great piece of fish topped with slaw, pico, and avocado crema- probably some of the best fish tacos in Phoenix.   The restaurant inside and outside are both very small, around 10 tables max for each...it's a cute quaint atmosphere- so keep this in mind when you pick where to sit.  We sat against the back patio outside which had a long bench running along one of the perimeters of the restaurant- it's situated next to an alley and can get decently busy, and with it starting to get dark outside, wasn't my favorite spot just because the people driving by tend to take the corners quickly.   Overall, we'll definitely be back for some grub, but will opt in for a table inside or under the shady tree next time!

pcIHHAsk_IaAyL-1KiSqNg.text: First time in Phoenix and decided to check out the restaurant in downtown area. It is located near the murals and other shops. The servers are super friendly and keeps checking up on me. I got the RoRo burger and Pear Shaped cocktail. Happy hour is 11-6 PM daily so super good deal to get a drink. The pear shaped was tasty that I barely tasted the alcohol. I have low tolerance so definitely feeling the drink but it was delicious. The burger was served with English muffin but it was a good match with all the ingredients. It was a bit overcooked for me and greasy but overall tasty. I'm not a fan of the fries because of the seasoning and flavor was a bit tart. Overall, food was great and unique vibe of the restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.

nXpZgrIMMDVQINXWp2Fp-Q.text: Its a cute cozy spot,perfect for a casual snack/dinner night. We got the veggie burrito and falafel and we're disappointed. I loved the burrito, it was delicious! Probably one of the best burritos I've had in Arizona. It was pretty filling too. Falafel was okay, could have been better. Tasted a little dry, a little more white sauce or any sauce would definitely make a difference. Husband had a cocktail which wasn't bad. Would go back for the burrito for sure.

5EkCpAASdXcSnKcUwtLaSA.text: On my first day in Phoenix, I met a colleague for the first time in-person. We clicked immediately, and she introduced me to the Dressing Room after our event. It was one of those moments when you know you can trust 100% of this friend's culinary recommendations and will hit them up every time you're in town.   I bet the Dressing Room is far more gorgeous in the daylight. There was so much to explore, but it was relatively near closing time and thus fairly empty. We sat at the bar where all the chefs were hanging out. We chatted, ate, and drank in a merrily fashion.   All the cocktails sounded amazing, and I can't remember what I got, but it was memorably delicious. My mouth is watering just thinking about them now. Even better were the fries. O.M.G. I've never tried better sauces. The spicy Russian was my favorite.  For my "main course" (though everything is a small plate) I got the All-Day Burrito. It was 11pm so how could I not be craving bacon, eggs, cheese, hash browns, avocado, corn, and pico de gallo in a tortilla?! It lived up to everything I hoped it would... and more with the sauce.  I'll definitely be back here next time, though I'm starting to realize there is an endless array of eateries and bars in Phoenix worth exploring. I'm grateful for good food & friendship, especially when those two things collide. What an evening to remember! Thanks, Dressing Room.

8deQ07GMYRf1E-v6MwA4cA.text: Today I was bumming around Roosevelt Row looking for a spot to do some work. I met up with my friend and fellow digital marketer Viktor on the corner of 3rd st and Roosevelt. For the first time in a long time I was not feeling Tacos. I wanted a burger. A juicy burger with some spice and some sort of mayo-ketchup sauce mix. Viktor suggested a place called The Dressing Room. I agreed and we walked on over. We opted to sit inside as we needed plugs to do a little work on some funnels. The staff was fast to come talk with us and give us menus. We were both starving. We both ordered the RoRo burger with frys. It was exactly what I wanted; a juicy burger, w/ sriracha mayo-ketchup sauce on an English muffin and salty seasoned fries. This was finished off with a cold iced tea as today AZ decided to skip spring and move to early summer. It hit the spot.

c7Ch3T4l4gU2ZomQWB9Lfg.text: My new spot. My girlfriend and I will be back to try everything on the menu.....twice.

fwcCJDyZCpvNQVrackwVNQ.text: First time here. We sat out on the patio, it was a nice day for that. There are heaters outdoors just in case though. The server was pleasant but he seemed to be too over excited about the food. We ordered the fries with avocado crema to dip the fries in. Both were very good. We also decided to try the pickles because server said they were amazing........not so. Tasted like butter chip pickles out of a jar. The pineapple non-alcoholic drink was not all that,tasted like watered down pineapple juice with too much ginger. I ordered the prime rib salad with peanut sauce. Again for the price there should have been more meat, it too was so-so. My husband had the fish tacos, that really smelled fishy, to me that's a sign of old fish. With some changes to these two dishes it could be "amazing" to try again, but I don't think we'll be returning. They are dog friendly if you sit out on patio....to me that's a plus!

l7zncBQklHWR-IogqqNBlw.text: Came during happy hour and was beyond content by the end of our experience. I haven't had service this good in a long time, truly a breath of fresh air. The staff was courteous and took time to explain their concept and menu to us while answering all the obnoxious questions I had. Food was very filling and tasty, I even got brought seconds of my shrimp free of charge purely out of kindness from the manager! The atmosphere was very pleasing and calm, simplistic yet elegant in design. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to get a drink after an afternoon at the museum. Also, the tajin dusted fries are amazing!!!!! Don't think twice just come!

HUrOtPIRJZE4T9zRvy4LFA.text: I liked the creativity but the burger with the English muffin just didn't do it for me. I guess that's the reason why this is the only place I have been to that serves burgers on muffins. If your looking for something different and want to explore than come try this place; but I probably won't be back on my own effort.

F-SeRAAgctsrxaKduy2LLQ.text: The vegetable tacos were amazing! As were the fries with avocado dip.  Really neat environment too!

_Ufqzk-qF0v8qeSOCSxAOw.text: 100% the place to come when you are coming downtown (from Scottsdale!) and want super fresh creative dinner in a cool atmosphere. Break out! We did!

PQ7-9kOJOEp9QowKDdxtLA.text: Lovely little hidden gem in downtown Phoenix. I had the ramen noodle salad and it was to die for! SQZqkbUQqc9RBgkJAlq-xA.text: very cool place the food is DELICIOUS! the service is awesome the waiters are very friendly and attentive. Will defintely be coming back!

RilXT4wr1uG04ih_VKaGwA.text: I had a great lunch yesterday here. It was so good, I came back with a second group of friends on the same day and enjoyed half priced drinks all day. cppG-gJbSVg-gh8-GCsV8g.text: Great food! The battered shrimp is amazing, taste fresh! Their churro sandwich is delicious.  I will definetly eat there again.

Rps27vGADzMv97kRdfvdiQ.text: I did not expect this coffee shop-looking place to have such an extensive menu! This was a fun place to go for lunch and even to study. It was not too loud and had a calm atmosphere. Their all day happy hour was definitely a selling point! The server was great and got the modifications of my order right and there were plenty of vegetarian options! The manager even came to check on my table and make sure we were taken care of. Overall, I had a great experience at the Dressing Room and will surely be going back!

3x1czgMZEaSk-g22nfnoFA.text: We were walking and I looked up dessert pictures in Yelp. When we saw the churro sandwich we knew we had to try and let me tell you it did not disappoint! The softest dough and yummy ice cream. Didn't love the chocolate sauce, but that didn't matter as we devoured the dessert quickly.

_SDMV272hoQ8e0TLYlloCQ.text: We were in the area and I was charged with finding us a lunch place. I made an excellent choice! We sat outside and were made very comfortable. The wait staff is super friendly. We started with the poutine. YUM YUM YUM! a unique take that didn't disappoint. We also had the guacamole which came with a delicious sauce on the side. The manager took time to explain how they make it so yummy. Now for the best part. The fish tacos. I try fish tacos at any place they are offered and am always disappointed. Not this time! They are lightly battered and full of flavor. The shell is delicate but holds up during eating. I asked for some more of the sauce that came with the guacamole and WOW. So happy we stopped here. Go. You'll love it.

wDdEMOnooplpoptzoORE6g.text: My son and I recently had dinner here for the first time. The restaurant is adjacent to the MonOrchid gallery.  The inside dining room is small, with counter seating in addition to a few tables, but there are two patios, one of which is quite large.  Overall, the space is comfortable and appropriately artsy in its decor.  I was very impressed with the meal we had.  My son ordered the shrimp and chips, and I had the Korean yakitori.  The yakitori is served lettuce-wrap style with a fantastic miso slaw and peanut sauce. The grilled ribeye was cooked perfectly and was very tender! The two bundles were so generously filled that I gave up trying to use my hands and used a fork.  My son's beer-battered shrimp were crisp and not at all greasy, and the malt vinegar aioli was a delicious twist. Great for dipping the fries in.  To drink, I ordered a cocktail called the Snoop: Gin, Aperol, Fresh Grapefruit Juice, Lemon. It was dangerous! Light and refreshing and way too easy going down.   I consider our meal an excellent value--the dishes were less expensive than my cocktail. I can't wait  to return, although I'm going to have a hard time trying something new since I'm still thinking about that yakitori! Oh, and the service was quite good, too.

zGEShs1arUg5jl_-PpubKw.text: Given the ratings I really expected much more from this place. The food was okay and nothing more, three of us came to dinner and not one of us finished out meal entirely. Tried the RoRo burger, it was over complicated, underseasoned, and absolutely drenched in butter. (which normally I am all for, but it resulted in my just needing to ditch the bun altogether. The "pickles" tasted more like cucumber with a ton of salt than actual pickles. The house salad, which any restaurant should be able to absolutely nail, was also underwhelming. The ranch tasted almost watered down, (not sure if this was a bad batch or what.) the food wasn't inedible, but also not worth the price.

hUVWoN_65LSd_HcraJXpRQ.text: First time there. Food was good, the only problem is parking!!!! I would like to suggest that the restaurant warn the patrons about parking in the back where you can't see the no parking signs. Parking enforcement came by and told us we could get a $400 parking ticket!!!!

2TNFdUhDDAoJ02WcrLG9cg.text: Such an amazing place we hit this spot on our anniversary and we're not disappointed, everyone and everything was great this was our first time here and we will definitely be back.  The food was a great spin on classic small plate grub turned into excellently plated meals , the drinks are good and packed a good punch, definitely recommended if you're down roosevelt

6vpg025pW6kR4Yz2-j6Kfw.text: Had an amazing time! Service is fast and so kind. Food and cocktails were amazing. Zach was our server and really just made the night unforgettable. Thanks Dressing Room!

-_ZvH_N_0Zy6oM9swCtjXA.text: Well placed location with outstanding service, food, and drinks. Don't think about it too much, just go in and try any cocktail or dish off their small but well chosen menu.   Ratings show that they're great, but at first I was hesitant to try The Dressing Room out because of the # of items on the menu. Another burger and taco joint...ehhhhh.   But once I got there I understood that the menu was limited because they've perfected every dish. I mean, the French fries were so exquisitely seasoned and ever so crispy but melt-in-your-mouth-y.   I'm originally from South Florida where there is an abundance of yummy ceviche spots. It's been a mission to find good ceviche in The Valley. But this ceviche, this ceviche right here...the best I've came across in AZ and at that it was a "salad".  The ceviche salad included a good portion of the fish, unlike other places where you feel as if you're swimming with your fork hoping to come across a bite of seafood.   Happy Hour is from 11-6 and all of their amazing cocktails are half off during those hours. Attentive waiters and a serene ambience. Highly recommended.

FFvFHmXEnPneU5_TycANdQ.text: I've been to the dressing room several times to take advantage of their fabulous happy hour! They have half off all drinks... specialty cocktails included.... From 11-6 every day. That's awesome! I do wish they had some food specials, but the drink specials beat out all other happy hours in downtown. Speaking of drinks... their drinks are a little hit and miss... they tend to have very strong cocktails, but maybe not the most delicious cocktails. The space is small but super cute. The food I've tried has been great...the roro burger is insanely tasty and comes with interestingly seasoned fries (tajin I think...). It's a good sized portion for the price (around 10$). Their fried cheese tacos were also super tasty. They are full of different components that all add up to a well balanced dish. I'd highly recommend the dressing room if you're in the downtown area.  Ps- you guys need a brunch! Then you'd be perfect.

FKZxByRY7lpFbuFfvYKORg.text: I have lived right down the street from this spot for years now and finally made it in. I was slightly disappointed with my experience but the tastiness is the food really made up for it! Our service wasn't great though, we were seated and it took a decent amount of time to get water, and then a different person came by maybe 5-10 minutes after that to take our drink order. Another 10-15 minutes goes by and another couple is seated, served water and drink orders taken all in one visit. Next, they are served their drinks before us, then the server takes their food order. So of course, they get their food before us and actually finished up before ours came out. Super frustrating since we had been there much longer in the first place, and of course we're hungry lol! But once the food came it was sooo tasty I will probably visit despite the service. I like to give the benefit of the doubt, maybe short staffed that day or something.

ELi003lugmm4MGK3i-VzHA.text: Phenomenal food and drinks! Kevin did a great job with our handcrafted drinks. The RoRo burger and pork belly fried rice were amazing. I4NNAhwFeeo7ZRzq1KFWGA.text: The Dressing Room has a cozy interior dining area with several 2 top tables in the main area and a few 4 top or more in the extended interior area. However it has a large outside patio with misters and great lighting at night. The music played was catchy, everyone seemed to enjoy it.   The menu is not large but has a great variety. I started with a bourbon drink with honey, orange and sage served over crushed ice.  It was refreshing and tasty, the sage was quite complementary to bourbon. They had several other crafted drinks and many craft beers on tap. My husband had a Mexican Coca Cola that was large & Ivey cold.  We shared a fried chicken sandwich, while the crust was slightly too brown, the chicken was moist and seasoned well.  It was served with a yummy tasty slightly but not overly creamy sweet dressing. It was really good. The fry were cooked perfectly and had a touch of lime and tajin on them, I'd never had them before but they were good.  The wait staff were friendly, concerned and timely. Definitely worth a visit!

i8VOd32eTRRXBfB2HCFlfA.text: They have the best burger.  Seriously yummy.  Fries have a spicy lime salt    Staff was excellent   We arrived about 30 mins to close.  They were welcoming and got our food out quick. Made sure our drinks were replenished.   They were cleaning but never left us two hanging.  I appreciate that.  We get off work at an odd hour.  It's nice to have a place to eat who genuinely welcomes guests to join.   The experience was great.   The burger.  I highly recommend it.

_im-vR6Fx9jGiOAP6Fr64w.text: This place is fantastic, and I'm so glad I found it on the first day of my stay in Phoenix, so that I can return often. Great happy hour deals?  Breakfast items all day?  What's not to like!  We of course had to start with a lunch cocktail. Mine was a conventional Old Fashioned, but that South American Sour is really interesting, as was our appetizer, the chorizo poutine, because chorizo and because poutine. It's very definitely shareable, and if you don't want to fill up on it, it's a great dish to share for 3 or 4.  We followed those with tacos. Once you pick one up, I hope you aren't planning to use your "taco hand" for a while. One reason is that it's just bursting with ingredients, like the large shrimp or fried fish, and the other is that everything is just so messy good that you will want to finish it in one hand-hold.   Finding the bathroom as a first-timer is a humorous adventure as well. I'll leave it at that so that other first time visitors can experience it. You might need a trail of bread crumbs.  What a great start to my visit in Phoenix!

CIoNUgkhN3ZNWjCOYkbcgg.text: Boom.  All tha stars!  Cool little place here.  Roosevelt street is quite the happening place and this joint is right in the center of it.   Connected to a coffee shop / art display / odd business office this place has a cool little outdoor backyard patio.   It's 105 outside but with the shade of the tree and the misters it was excellent outside.    Had the roro burger and it was excellent.  Cooked perfect and the onions and cheese complimented it well.  Great fries as well  The server was awesome.  Super helpful and pleasant.     Will absolutely return!

TinBrC56XdnZAdoDrydYGQ.text: First off Thank you Kevin for your hospitality on our first visit to the Dressing Room.  Stumbled across this gem and let me say they have Happy Hour every day 11-6 yes please thank you! Half off wine beer and  cocktails specials.  So sorry I was so hungry I forgot to take pictures.  We ordered Korean fried rice which was maybe the best fried rice I have ever had and a chicken Sammy was off the chart.  We love the ambiance and we look forward to patio weather again because the patio looks to be quite  quaint. See you soon at The Dressing Room.

o0yCrHpSn-x_QQ6FYGKTAA.text: 5 stars for food, innovation, and ambiance.  2 stars for service, sadly.  We found ourselves in DTPHX, which is unusual for us, so we wanted to hit a few spots. The reviews led us here, and we immediately loved the location and concept. The place is TINY, but really, really cool. The bar and the kitchen are one and the same, with 3-4 people working crammed into the area, which is small but open air. You get to literally sit at the bar and watch your food being made 5 feet away.  We ordered the RoRo burger and the southern fried chicken sammy, both which came with fries. Absolutely heaven, both items. Truly, not a single complaint about the food. Huge compliments to the chef! We each had two drinks, wanting to try/share several things. We got the spiked chai, the Paloma, the Negroni, and an old fashioned. They were all strong and delicious!  Now to the service and our complaints. We literally sat at the bar in this tiny establishment. Took several minutes to be greeted and have our order taken by the bartender (though, I should note that the cook directly in front of us greeted us quickly and engaged us throughout the night. Again, compliments). Both of our waters were completely empty at one point, for several minutes. Our food arrived quickly, but was literally gone by the time our bartender checked on us. We didn't see or hear from her for over 20 minutes!   Reluctantly we ordered another drink, because my heart was really set on trying the spiked chai. We wanted the churro ice cream sandwich dessert but decided against it this visit. As she was making the chai, the shaker cup she was using actually flew off across the "kitchen," spilling foamy chai everywhere, and she laughed and yelled something about power hour. We then watched her pour just the remainder of my drink and serve it to me. We had asked for our check when we ordered this round, and we were ready to just go. As we reviewed our check, we realized all 4 of our drinks had been rung in as the spiked chai, which at $11 was the most expensive drink we ordered. 2 of the 4 were only $9 drinks. C'mon now, that's shady! Again, we were totally over it by that point so we just left, but I know we should have complained.  During happy hour they have half price cocktails, so we will come back for that and that churro dessert, we will just hope for better service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paloma and Negroni cocktails. These were our faves!
Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern Fried Chicken Sammy, and fries with a side of spicy Russian sauce

9k8_uBcrrw6mZ5UqfBXiQQ.text: The Dressing Room has been on my list for an incredibly long time. And while I still have mixed feelings on the whole gentrification of Roosevelt Row, I do feel that there's plenty of respectful food options all packed into this little area.  The Dressing Room fits in just fine. Food-wise, I think as a neighborhood spot for local meetups, it works - especially those who are a sucker for sleeve tattoos, beards, and gluten allergies.   Our starter of guacamole and salsa roja came with tostadas instead of the usual chips. Guac was standard fare and salsa was excellent. The main dinner menu is short and simple, offering up a single burger, some taco options, all-day breakfast creations, and a few unique items to boot.  My girlfriend and I split a RoRo burger, which immediately got my attention from pictures due to the inclusion of what I still maintain is one of the most under-appreciated burger upgrades: The English Muffin. If you're unfamiliar, visit LGO or Diabo Burger to learn more.  As for the Dressing Room's take on it? I'd say it was just okay. The bun didn't really seem toasted, but more soggy than anything else. Burger ingredients were all decent, but without a killer muffin, the sandwich wasn't quite as memorable as I was hoping it would be. Their fries, included as a side, have some kind of chili seasoning on them which I felt kind of neutral about.  We also opted for the Korean pork belly fried rice. This may or may not be to your liking, but I appreciated this dish for its complex flavor and rather unique style.  For dessert, I really wanted to try their tres leches cake, but since every single person on Yelp seems to default to their churro sandwich and since I could find no pic examples of the cake, we went with their most popular choice. Sadly, I've experienced better versions of this dessert at other establishments. Their churros include sugar instead of cinnamon and had a texture that was very doughy - almost like it was undercooked. It tasted more like just eating fried dough with some ice cream and my girlfriend and I didn't finish it (which rarely happens).  If you're not familiar with this area, parking will be a nightmare. Please note that there's a free lot for customers on 2nd Street and Roosevelt. Look for the mural of the birds. It'll save you a lot of cursing and confusion.  Ultimately, I think this is definitely a place worth checking out if you haven't been. Based on reviews, the Dressing Room has its fair share of fans. And although I can't say that we were blown away by every single thing we tasted, I can easily see where the appeal lies with many locals.  Recommended to check out!

6s9rPSVP7t0PBpleWAMDHw.text: If we're talking just drinks, The Dressing Room gets 5 stars. The place has wonderful atmosphere and fantastic drinks. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Prepare to have to wait occasionally as it can get extremely busy. The food is good, but not great and a little on the pricey side. We had the tostada and ceviche, fries and the fish tacos.   Overall, I would definitely be back. The Dressing Room is a Phoenix staple and you would not be disappointed.

Ag2KbgXjMl0N3A_7Diau5Q.text: Great place!   Food=5 stars, Drinks=5 stars Service=5 stars Facilities=5 stars  This is a great downtown joint! Everyone from the bussers to the manager were super nice. The presentation and taste of the food is great. And who'd of thought Tajin on fries is soo good?! Mmmm... The Korean Pork Belly Fried Rice was both substantial and amazing as well.

c-DOBlNMWMtve-ht6MKBVg.text: First time trying this place and even without a drink of alcohol, I fell in love with the vibe and atmosphere. The food is hands down worth every penny. Me and my boyfriend split the RoRo burger and the fried chicken. They have amazing flavor and even the salad was incredible! Thank you so much for the great first time experience

teYtoj9poudR17CmQReuLw.text: Wow. Simply wow.  I would have to say that the Dressing Room was one of my favorite places in Phoenix. It's located on Roosevelt near some very cool graffiti art so I highly recommend eating here either before or after you explore this artistic area.  When we got there we were greeted by I think the Manager. All the other waiters were pretty nice as well. Always is nice when you have friendly workers. The weather was about as warm as the vine here so we decided to sit outside. Once we figured out our seating arrangement, our waiter let us know about Happy Hour and I was pumped.  We ordered so much stuff on the menu and everything was delicious. The Pork Belly Fried Rice was addicting. The Bulgogi Gyoza had me wanting more Fried Rice. The Roro Burger was Juicy. The Fries with the sauces were super good. Seriously everything here is good. What makes Dressing Room also so amazing is the affordable prices with the diversity of the menu. If I do come back to Arizona, I'll definitely be trying to plan a trip back to the Dressing Room!!

XuOP-ka7vAzjbgvhTod4dQ.text: Great location. The Dressing Room can get pretty busy for dinner. Service is excellent. Food is tasty! I really enjoyed their fries and your choice of dipping sauce. I enjoyed eating their cold pad-thai. It is something different and refreshing. They have a few vegetarian options and not too sure about vegan options though. I recommend coming for dinner for the atmosphere is very inviting.

IC43c5iqR-J3cT7ETDpwGg.text: I have been really lucking out lately in finding local Phoenix hidden gems. The Dressing Room was a great find. I love how they have happy hour from 11-6 daily. That deal cannot be beat. I started with a  Paloma. Often, I find them too sweet, but this one was absolutely perfect. I had a really hard time deciding what to order because so much sounded so good but unfortunately I only have one stomach. I love breakfast burritos and decided to give it a shot. It was the best one I've had in Phoenix. They put corn and avocado in it and it was amazing. The best part was the churro ice cream sandwich. It was probably one of the best desserts I have had. I need to go back soon and try some more items. Our server was super helpful and attentive. If you are in the area this place is a must try!

b9ffMkVZQprdPSdR1IeG3g.text: Extremely delicious. The all day breakfast burrito is all of the egg burrito flavors perfectly matched. With the salsa, it is great!  The burger with the fries  the meat is so lucky! And fries and amazing, the seasoning on them makes them so flavorful.

4yl-a5EBvGziiribs7mzCg.text: My friend and I came to The Drrssing Room for the vegetarian options and we both loved it. I got the all day burrito without bacon and my friend got the be sammy. Both are making my mouth water as I think about them. Broken down, the be sammy was an egg and cheese, but the buttery onion roll it came out on was unique.   The menu as a whole didn't come from a single country's cuisine and is interesting to choose from. The servers were relaxed and kind and the warehouse interior made it perfect place to catch up with friends. There is an adjoining gallery to The Dressing Room as well as an cool past to the building which you can read about on the website.

NBcEWV7bkV21cs6MAnofmg.text: If you're looking for a good burger in Phoenix, go to the Dressing Room! My husband and I visited The Dressing Room on a beautiful, Sunday afternoon. We were immediately seated on the outdoor patio.   Based on yelp reviews, we each ordered the RoRo Burger and substituted the English muffin for a brioche bun. We also each got fries as a side. Our food did take a while to arrive, maybe 30 minutes, however our attentive waiter brought us some complimentary chips and black bean salsa to snack on while we waited for our meals. It was delicious and made us look forward to our meal.  The RoRo burger is BY FAR THE BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER EATEN. The burger was flavorful, the onions added a crunch that complimented the complex textures of the burger and the aioli added a slightly salty flavor to the burger. I loved everything about it. The fries were also pretty good as well - crispy, salty and had me reaching for more. I ended up eating my husband's fries too.   The exceptional service and phenomenal food exceeded our expectations. We will definitely be back.

WdrBPHbaBc4-2WyZT5aHJg.text: Incredible!!  Where to start? The vibe is super cool and chill. The patio incorporates all that's good about restaurant patios in arizona. Misters, cool music, shade...  Then the food... perfection. We had the bulgogi pot stickers, Korean fried rice, the burger, and the chorizo omelet (there were 4 of us) oh and the fish tacos    Everything was perfectly cooked and delicious.  Then... the dessert.  churro ice cream sandwich... was like last meal on earth worthy.  Oh, and to top it off the service was first rate, water glasses always full.  Bottom line... this is a class act, worthy of frequent visits and bringing friends. So glad we found this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churro ice cream sandwich

_N3u2l-7VwqSPjCvrNJDuA.text: Absolutely amazing lunch was had at this hip joint today! We love coming to downtown Phx to experience new culinary delights and today we found a really gem!  We started with the Bulgogi Gyoza - super great!  Then onto our main course -My girlfriend and I shared the TJ tacos (fish tacos) which were great!....BUT Let's take a moment of silence for the Korean pork belly fried rice (TO DIE FOR!) -my hubby had the chorizo scramble which he said was Excellent  -her hubby had the RoRo burger - and cleaned the plate  Needless to say not a speck of food was left on anyone's plate  .....but the best part was the finisher ....and you all need to have it THE CHURRO ICE CREAM SANDY - need I say more?!  The service was top notch too!  We can wait to return!

TXAn3fk8FApk1HMCrE3gTA.text: The food was delish! The space was very quaint and cozy with great service. The Korean fried rice was our favorite! It was so well seasoned, a must have. For dessert we had churros and ice cream.... you can't go wrong with it. Would definitely recommend.

SCyA4Yqbuxi8emtgfqwO9Q.text: The happy hour wine pricing and selection was great,  The veggie tacos were yummy.  I LOVE the mature mesquite trees they have added to the patio area tucked behind the building on the alley - you still get a street view and vibe,

Aq-BBVL3VSKasEm6rw8bpQ.text: I would write a long paragraph but, why? Straight and to the point...  This place was awesome!

-4jjF2YYE212iuznlJXLzQ.text: This location is beyond cool and the food and service is better! I will definitely be back soon. Thanks team!

DGvEtEg2kooMIh6Ag-x_WQ.text: My family and I stopped in here after a long day of traveling, and we couldn't have picked a better place! The menu is small but the dishes were awesome. Everything was fresh, full of flavor, and reasonably priced. We sat outside but the mist and shade kept us comfortable. The food, cocktails, and churro ice cream sandwich were all amazing and the service was equally as great. Wish we weren't from out of town so we could come back!

LOxG1KemhLmiQYAdHWo1Qg.text: It was great! Small but adequate menu but the dessert was delicious. I wish they had a little more lighting on the back patio. But the food was perfect!

BbRJpr2Asy64WLy0IB3FBQ.text: What a great place!  Terrific happy hour drink prices, tasty eats & outstanding service.  We will definitely be back!

3-w0Hsnp2T2I3AuEtoSTSw.text: I actually signed up for Yelp to post this review. Great food. The cocktails were amazing. People were friendly and very cool. Just visiting from out of town but will be back for sure before I leave.

ZbUCHDvXCCZmqdnBqVytyg.text: Had a great time here. The atmosphere is very enjoyable and the food is even better. They have great fries with an amazing dipping sauce. Great place to go for a relaxed fun filled experience

qQINtHa2yNdiU4i-GO748Q.text: The food is very good. Service was great! They just opened, but we didn't see any issues. We were greeted during our meal and were thanked for coming. Our group had the fish tacos, breakfast burrito, Korean Yakitori and the hamburgers and everyone was happy and satisfied. Next time we are in Phoenix....we will for sure go back!

PTk4fgdhYOfDHJwYIHhg8w.text: Awesome food, best fries and best service! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to other people and I will definitely come back with my family! Kyu Utsunomiya and Troy Watkins are the best owners any restaurant could ever have. They are the best! The servers are also better that ever!

pRHjPSC4vlKsXqpLLAJGdw.text: Awesome menu, chill atmosphere and no wait on a Saturday night--but that's about to change when word of mouth spreads. Get in there while there's still time!!

KhyTFvfAMHo_utKeyP-vNw.text: Service good but food pretty  greasy..  ordered Diet Coke but got coke  light.  Nice ambience.  2.5 more appropriate rating,

mEnJOVPv4-1abPrQTTDvUg.text: TJ tacos were bomb. Everybody is super nice. Great place. Good portion size. Half off happy hour.

IHQzlNP8iY_8s_HDXKmXjg.text: Awesome first taste of Phoenix. The story of the joint is pretty neat, and fits the eclectic artsy vibe. A nice long happy hour is a sure plus and was an unexpected treat for our lunch. I highly recommend the Paloma and the RoRo burger. Also the two sauces I tried on the unique, spicy fries were the malt aioli and the avo crema, and both were deliciously good. I'd come back, and I'd probably have the same thing!

wT4dfBzydMUWKdesD7YWkw.text: This restaurant just opened 1/22/17. Found it while killing time downtown Phoenix before going to airport. Great find! Food excellent, cocktails spectacular & great friendly service. Small but cheery atmosphere. Has outdoor seating too. Limited but creative menu. We had Peruvian cerviche & cold soba noodle bowl. Both were fresh & very tastey. Had Peppered Flower & both bourbon cocktails. Loved all of them. Generous size drinks & quite a bargain at their long happy hour. Make sure you get the churro ice cream sandwich for desert. Yum! I hated sharing it with my spouse. Look forward to my next visit!

izNCRDiXPMNB3awq_tvzAg.text: Had the RoRo Burger.  Damn it was just what I wanted.  Tangy, Spicy, now I want another on.  Friendly staff, prompt service.  Fun creative environment.

pPzSRVKJZ0g4ILDTxKbRyg.text: Fantastic drinks and tacos. Great little patio, right next door to Monorchid Gallery. Wonderful new gem downtown.

tDQp0jRPLtNkhINtueMSeQ.text: This place is delicious and their drinks are something to write home about.  It's super small but when the weather is nice the patio is open and it feels bigger.  We ordered hamburgers and had three of their signature drinks and everything was on point.  I would definitely come back here and would even be OK to wait if there was one.

sNTMYhN1M4u1321VOsSwNA.text: Love this place! Their food is delicious. I had the veggie tacos and my boyfriend got the RoRo burger and we were both extremely pleased. And you have to get the churro ice cream sandwich! It is a smaller restaurant though so it's a little more intimate of a setting but also a really cool vibe.

sHY7IoTBo21iJvwGkliswQ.text: Customer service was a solid 5 stars. And food quality was a solid .5 I ordered the shrimp and chips, and my girlfriend ordered the burrito. For 9 dollars I was expecting a bit more than 5 small shrimp, let alone on a plastic diner plate. Wish they had the traditional fish n ships w a twist , something worth the buck and not on a plastic basket plate w parchment.  Girlfriends burrito; not impressed at all, unfortunately. 8 dollars for a small burrito with cheese that was clearly the Kraft processed individually wrapped slices of cheese. They had large kernels of corn in the burrito that were a little funky. If they did away w the corn maybe they'd have a little more for better cheese.  At the end the owner kindly stopped by and asked about the meal, we let him know we weren't too satisfied. He listened to our feedback and had us try an excellent churro ice cream sandwich, which was again served on a plastic basket.  It's a beautiful corner, beautiful space, just doesn't seem as much effort was given to to production to the food rather the ambiance.  Will return again in hopes ownership sees this and makes adjustments.

0WYdxjBte_v4LWl-JEYYUg.text: Just passing through Phoenix on our way to Sedona and wanted to grab a bite near the airport. Did a quick search and decided to give this a go. Neighborhood is funky, artsy and still a bit transitional. It's not a large place so we almost missed it. We were sat in the backyard under a large tree. Even at 2 pm there was still a steady crowd. We had the breakfast burrito, the shrimp and chips and the ah-maz-ing Churro Ice Cream Sandwich. The french fries were spectacular and seasoned with a variety of spices and just a hint of lemon juice. I would have never thought of putting lemon juice on french fries, but I loved it! But the standout was definitely the churro ice cream sandwich. Crunchy, cinnamon-y and lightly fried halves were filled with a homemade vanilla bean ice cream that gave just the right amount of sweetness. A total mess to eat, but worth every napkin. Would definitely stop back whenever in town.

uA5jCL3MjwnjCvD7kFvUcg.text: My husband and I are so glad we found this place. Delicious food, helpful and attentive staff, and a very cool vibe. We also enjoyed that drinks were half off for happy hour. Fantastic experience!

j62qoc5WcK7Qb_Dfj-y7LQ.text: Best Place Ever!!! Great food! Great staff! Great Vibes!!!!! And Amanda is the best !! Go see her!!!

NCmvODRm_H6ohqBmAglTtA.text: Great atmosphere, location, friendly staff. My husband ordered the shrimp and chips I got the fish tacos, which were both unfortunately undercooked.  The cocktails were really good, we got the old fashioned and the rosemary and sage. Also, reasonably priced.

8iM4baB_RgUopAJiBLtHGA.text: You should probably go here. I hate telling people this because I want it to be a secret spot in Phoenix but it is so delicious. If you go here, get the burger and the fries you will not be disappointed.

8vQzS-YedzOjBClEjxgNGg.text: Wow- SO good!! Ceviche salad with tostada to scoop it up.  Manager was super personable and passionate about the place.  Wonderful!

-WjbdQcsxAqLd-BpsPFclQ.text: I selfishly don't want the word to get out too quickly about what a great spot this is. As good- even better - than I'd hoped it would be as I eagerly awaited their opening. All dishes we ordered were interesting, flavorful and well crafted. And the cocktails we had were delicious too. Bill was about $40 for 3 dishes, 2 cocktails and left us very full and happy. Our new regular spot for sure!   Ps Since drafting my review above I've been back 4 more times... It's almost embarrassing but I have a giant crush! And don't miss the churro vanilla sandwich. There's only one dessert for good reason.

PPkXbCiegTHN-Betb18H3A.text: I swung by here after a flight from California on my way to Sedona, and have to say... this place's veggie tacos are the best I ever had. Flavorful, delicious, not too heavy, creative and unique. Loved the atmosphere too - hip and cool, and friendly service. I would love to come again.

qIsWZ_zDxmGRJxb0oLANZA.text: Another great addition to the arts district. Smallish space but cozy patio and tasty menu options.

g1Ie9aIblpWwP-sj-ezASg.text: Great cocktails, great food, great ambiance.  I wish I could have tried each cocktail as they all looked fantastic. The Spiked Chai was quite satisfying.  We heard the burgers and fries were good so that's what we went for: one Classic and one RoRo. You could smell when you walked in that they knew how to do burgers right. They were perfectly cooked as ordered (medium rare). The fries were tasty as was our side of pickles.  And the churro ice cream sandwich was worth licking the bowl (but I resisted the urge; barely).  If I could give 4.5 stars I would because the service wasn't quite perfect. Our waitress could have been a little quicker with refills and seemed tired or sore. But it did bot ruin the experience and would not prevent me from returning.

CualTLHF_z1MSap21EpKAw.text: Love this place. Small inside with a big patio. The chef is tremendous and has come up with a simple menu that does not disappoint. The burgers come on an English muffin, which sounds weird but it's actually brilliant. The muffin is nicely toasted and allows the burger to be the star of the show. You can eat a big cheeseburger here, and not feel gross and too full when you walk out. Thank the English muffin bun for that.

hliBMkdVrqH5sdv8wNsCAg.text: Great atmosphere, great service with h excellent food and drinks.  Happy hour daily 11am-6pm

ELYKWUgE2C6Ofh2MxbqAFA.text: Was in the neighborhood and hungry. Saw the other reviews and decided to try it. Great atmosphere and terrific people. Real urban feel. Oh, and the TJ tacos and iced tea were excellent. Highly recommend!

lfnHM1S-ie-iPcn68JDL0g.text: We ate lunch here twice on our way to/fro Grand Canyon via Phoenix airport.   Great service - waiter and owner were very attentive and made sure we were taken care of promptly.  Never had an empty glass or long wait for anything. Wonderful food - everything was cooked perfectly and was very tasty.  Churro ice cream sandwich was a nice way to end a flavorful meal on a hot day. Pleasant surroundings - patio had trees and misters to keep us cool while the interior was clean and nicely decorated. Highly recommend and would visit again the next time we're in town.

DsMcve4OvXz_p2dOcYW3mQ.text: What a fantastic restaurant! Incredible atmosphere, great music, amazing staff, everything! What I love is the overall excellence and attention to detail. From the spotless kitchen, to the cocktails, everything! The Dressing Room's standard is Excellence, & they deliver it on every level! Thankful for our fantastic server Evelyn, the kind manager Brian, & the staff as a whole! Keep up the great work everyone! We'll be back soon with some new faces!

hfd2jgVnZGTSb4y_vO05Ww.text: I was with a group in town for a conference. We were seated on the patio for dinner. Awesome ambience ( music & lighting), delicious food, and great service. Very cool place!

qfMc2PW91XWuEO1T5x6SbA.text: Very simple menu, lettuce wrapped beef was so tender, no knife needed!  Breakfast burrito was filling.  Decor was industrial, very chic!  Will definately return to try more from the menu!

ftuk3eu_ev2HA1KW7qjliQ.text: Just tried this place the other night with the family and it definitely did not live up to the reviews. The place looks so cool and hip with a great patio area but the menu is VERY limited. The beef yakatori was very fatty and we had 3 different servings of it between us so it was just one bad order. the seasoned fires and different dipping sauces were good. The all day egg burrito was very average. No plans to return here. Such a let down as the outside, inside and patio area was so nice.

_hMfgVwJ-XEPCqwFe_nZHA.text: Spur of the moment thing. Very cool. Shares space with an art gallery. People very friendly. Owner by the name of "Q" made a point of introducing himself. Food was special. Burger was top of line. Had that extra special something. Peruvian ceviche salad was unlike anything I have had before. Every taste was new and delish. Highly recommend this spot.

57doUspFp_cAkUsE53mSkA.text: Absolutely love the roro burger and the lemonade is out of this world!! Will suggest to anyone and everyone of my friends and coworkers  one of my favorite downtown eats

UwCIg-FDsq6Z3mtoR_O3_A.text: Great customer service! An attentive waiter saw that I didn't like what I had ordered. He alerted his manager, who came over and promptly replaced it for me. The Ro burger and the pork belly fried rice are awesome! Great atmosphere. Would visit again. If you're traveling through Phoenix or live there, check this place out.

sO8AQVmmF-aq8GQ_Yrk5dA.text: This place is amazing!  Quaint little bar with outside seating.  Great food and wonderful wine.  Best of all, Malone and Chelsea made us feel so welcome.  Most people don't take the time and care they did to discuss the menu, bring us a taste of wine before we bought a glass and chat with us about their menu and the surrounding area.  You are missing out if you don't give The Dressing Room a try!

loLQ8QBFAifTREldsIskJQ.text: The burger and fries were delicious.. the service was fast and friendly. Went during happy hour and the cocktails were half off. Would definitely go there again for the burger and fries!

U6CLEs9j3QjMHFDNCRGnuA.text: The Churro ice cream sandwich, to die for. An absolute game changer and Churros will never be the same.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dressing Room - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Game changer. 11/10 would smash.

yzi6SlorzGWcETsEGzyoGQ.text: This is a nice little cafe style restaurant with a limited, but good menu. Prices are reasonable and everyone exudes a positive vibe, from the moment you enter the restaurant. We were greeted at the door by several employees and promptly seated with our choice of inside or outside seating (we chose outside). The waitress Kat was very amicable and recommended the Korean Yakitori. Its basically two strips of marinated beef seasoned w sesame seed oil / and sprinkled on top w sesame seeds. The beef is on top of a taco like lettuce wrap, w the insides comprised of a slaw like salad. Lots of greens... the only thing it needed was Saracha  Sauce to make it spicy ( my recommendation).  This item was flavorful and after eating, did not leave there feeling like i ate a gut bomb.  The only negative, is no public parking, and can be an issue if it gets full. Overall I would rate the place as a solid 4 stars, staff and service an easy 5 stars. Overall 4.5 stars.  Thx
